Job Responsibilities: About the Company At ORA, we believe that health and well being should be more accessible, convenient and personal. We're build a modern digital experience that enables patients to access care on their terms, with brands that deliver high quality, speciality treatments and care for a number of chronic condition. We are a house of healthcare brands powered by a vertically integrated telehealth platform. Founded in 2020, ORA is now SEA’s fastest growing digital health provider operating in Singapore, Malaysia and the Philippines with additional markets being launched soon. Our growing portfolio of healthcare brands includes andSons (men’s health), OVA (women’s health) and Modules (online dermatology). We are young company with experimentation as part of our DNA. We frequently iterate to conviction with a strong hypotheses-led culture. The whole company sets quarterly OKRs and has the ability to rapidly shift gears in response to new insights, or changing market conditions in order to deliver on our company-wide objectives. It is critical for us that you share these philosophies, are adaptable to change and comfortable with solving for ambiguity. We don’t just talk about customer-centricity, “patients first” is a core company value and we work closely across our marketing, product, medical support and clinical teams to deliver high-quality health care to our patients. In 2024, we have ambitious plans to expand our operations further in Asia with the core objective of leveling up our core healthcare infrastructure, investing in greater personalisation and delivering higher touch services and support for sustained health outcomes We have recently our $10M Series Around of fundraising, banking the biggest round of any telehealth player in South East Asia and unlocking the next stage of our journey. Healthcare is usually slow and boring. We believe in its potential to be exciting and entertaining. But changing the healthcare experience is hard - and we're gonna need all the help we can get....! Want to be part of it? Values we want to see: Curiosity: Growth mindset, a hunger to learn and expand horizons, a genuine interest in the world. The patience and perseverance to get it right, and the empathy for ORA Group to find the right solutions. Capability: Top of their game, unique and rare talent with the potential to build a once ina generation company with us. Humility: Complete lack of arrogance and skilled at holding themselves accountable with owner mindset. High levels of self-awareness, always wanting to improve, most comfortable in a feedback culture. A true mix of ambition and compassion. Executive Experience: A focus on disciplined execution. Not just a dreamer, not starting things but never ending them, but rather someone who knows how to get a job done. Owner Mindset: Work with an ownership mindset and proactivity. What you'll do (Responsibilities) We are looking for a dynamic and ambitious Junior BI Analyst to take ownership of the activities details below Collaborate with stakeholders from different BUs to identify key business questions and data requirements Integrate data from different sources to centralized reporting via Extrac, Transfrom, and load (ETL) techniques Carry out data cleaning, validation, and quality assurance to ensure accuracy and consistency of new and existing reports Analyse data to identify areas of opportunity as well as areas of weakness, and come up with recommendations for business improvement Assist with relevant performance analysis for periodic business reviews Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using BI tools Support ad-hoc analysis requests and contribute to ongoing data projects "Integrate data from different sources to centralized reporting via Extrac, Transfrom, and load (ETL) techniques" to "Integrate data from different sources to centralized reporting via Extract, Transfrom, and load (ETL) techniques" [Extrac --> Extract; spelling error] Performance Measurement Utilisation rate of data dashboard Request turnaround time Revenue and/or cost impact of insights Qualifications Completed a Bachelor's Degree or pursuing one and in their final year of studies Proficiency in SQL, Python and advanced Google Sheets functions; others programming languages are a bonus Familiarity with BI tools like Power BI, Looker Studio, Tableau etc Prior experience or internship in business intelligence, data analysis, or related field is a plus Key Competencies Strong analytical & problem solving skills: Ability to analyse, draw conclusions, and recommend appropriate actions in response to data Business oriented, paying attention to details and result driven Strong social & interpersonal skills Able to work across functional areas and levels of the organisation Strong verbal and written communication: ability to simplify, synthesise and convince Positive attitude & mindset Rigorous and organised, meeting deadlines and ensuring team performance Ability to work in fast paced startup environment Reporting Lines Report to the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst Others Position based in Singapore Not travel required

Good knowledge of the geosciences & reservoir engineering applications and data management best practices. Holding a certificate in Data science. Good awareness of the oil and gas upstream industry workflows. Familiarity with data visualization and machine learning tools. Capable in handling data repository system and management and building data-driven solution. Ability to build and present data visually using tools such as Power BI. Arc GIS and Geophysics experience are desirable. Good project management and planning skills Good communication and collaboration skills Good interpersonal skills Information Technology skills Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Good data visualization and presentation skills

Job Responsibilities: Hi, we’re Actabl. Are you excited about a career in SaaS that has a direct effect on the hospitality industry? This might be the perfect opportunity for you! Our mission is to empower the people that power hospitality. We’re on a journey to provide better solutions for hotel companies as the world around us evolves and changes related to using technology, finding labor, and maximizing profits. We give hoteliers actionable insights to know what to do, the tools to do it, and the visibility to know it worked. We bring together powerful hospitality tech solutions to maximize profits for more than 10,000 properties in hospitality markets around the world. Our Valued Behaviors Start with People: We are in the hospitality business and hospitality starts with people. This impacts both our being and our doing. Being: We are responsible for building relationships, earning trust, and having fun. These things are fundamental to hospitality. Doing: We will succeed if we start with great people working as one team. Empower others, speak the truth with care, and go together. Demand Integrity: Be trustworthy, be ethical, and be consistent whether someone is watching or not. Demand integrity of yourself and others to build the fabric of a high-integrity organization. Delight the Customer: We aim to delight our customers in the same way our customers aim to delight their guests. The question is not if completed a process or hit a metric, the question is whether or not the customer is delighted. Champion Innovation: We compete in the game of change and win through innovation. Think big and then think bigger when it comes to the innovation required to tackle the problems our customers face daily. Make it Happen: We show up prepared, care about the details, and follow through. Don't get distracted. Don't stop at blockers. Don't make excuses. Find a way and drive until it is done. Your Role - Come Join Our Team! Position Summary: The Director of Data Governance will be responsible for developing and implementing a data governance strategy and framework that promotes a data-driven culture while ensuring data quality, integrity, and security. Collaborating closely with multiple departments, the Director will establish and maintain data governance policies, standards, and practices that align with and support business objectives. Essential Duties: Data Governance Leadership: Develop and implement a comprehensive data governance strategy and framework Evaluate the organization's data governance needs and propose a suitable organizational structure Assess the current data governance tool and recommend whether to retain or replace it. Establish data governance policies, standards, and procedures to ensure data quality, integrity, and security Establish & lead the Data Governance Committee and collaborate with stakeholders to drive data governance initiatives Monitor compliance with data governance policies and address any issues or gaps Data Quality and Integrity: Define and enforce data quality standards and metrics Implement data quality management processes to ensure accurate and reliable data Conduct regular data quality assessments and audits Work with data stewards to resolve data quality issues and improve data accuracy Data Security and Privacy: Develop and enforce data security and privacy policies in compliance with regulatory requirements Ensure data protection measures are in place to safeguard sensitive information Collaborate with IT and legal teams to address data security and privacy concerns Monitor and respond to data breaches or security incidents Collaboration and Communication: Foster a data-driven culture by promoting the importance of data governance across the organization Provide training and support to employees on data governance policies and best practices Communicate data governance goals, progress, and outcomes to senior leadership and stakeholders Collaborate with IT, legal, compliance, and business units to align data governance efforts with business objectives Minimum Qualifications: Proven experience in data governance, data management, or a related field (8+ years) Strong understanding of data governance frameworks, policies, and best practices Experience with data quality management, data security, and privacy regulations Knowledge of data management tools and technologies Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills x`Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and influence stakeholders Key Competencies: Develop and Implement Data Governance Framework: Experience in Data Governance: Proven track record of developing and implementing data governance strategies and frameworks. Policy Development: Ability to create and enforce data governance policies, standards, and procedures. Stakeholder Collaboration: Strong skills in collaborating with stakeholders to ensure alignment with organizational objectives. Attention to Detail: Meticulous in ensuring data quality, integrity, and security. Project Management: Ability to manage projects effectively and meet deadlines. 2. Evaluate and Optimize Data Governance Tools: Technical Expertise: In-depth knowledge of data governance tools and technologies. Analytical Skills: Ability to assess and evaluate the effectiveness of current tools. Decision-Making: Strong decision-making skills to recommend whether to retain or replace tools. Implementation Skills: Experience in successfully implementing new tools or enhancing existing ones. Problem-Solving: Proactive approach to identifying and addressing tool-related issues. 3. Design and Propose Data Governance Organizational Structure: Organizational Design: Experience in evaluating and designing organizational structures. Strategic Thinking: Ability to align the organizational structure with data governance needs and business objectives. Presentation Skills: Strong skills in developing and presenting proposals to senior leadership. Leadership: Ability to gain approval and lead the implementation of the proposed structure. Change Management: Experience in managing change and driving organizational improvements. 4. Enhance Data Quality and Security: Data Quality Management: Expertise in defining and enforcing data quality standards and metrics. Audit and Assessment: Experience in conducting data quality assessments and audits. Regulatory Compliance: Knowledge of data security and privacy regulations and ability to ensure compliance. Crisis Management: Ability to respond effectively to data breaches or security incidents. Training and Communication: Skills in training employees on data governance policies and best practices. Work Environment: May require travel

The Technical Operations Executive is responsible for making sense of data from various sources. This can be achieved by developing and maintaining automated reporting and data management processes and dashboard to track and communicate financial, operations data and KPIs with various stakeholders. The role works closely with the Banking Operations, Compliance, Investment, Business Intelligence teams and Data Engineers to define and achieve report/ data goals. The Technical Operations Executive is expected to be analytical, attentive to details and continuously identifying opportunities for improvement while keeping a keen eye on the big picture. He/she grasps complex topics quickly and is adept at thinking on their feet to solve problems in a creative and holistic manner. Daily Responsibilities: Develop and maintain reports / dashboards which communicate financial and operational data and KPIs. Collect and interpret financial and operational data from various sources. Collaborating with stakeholders from various departments to define report/ data goals and data engineers to set up data pipelines for data extraction. Develop and maintain departmental documentation, including report/dashboard specifications. Participate in project planning, execution, monitoring, and providing status updates to stakeholders. Other Responsibilities: In between reporting and data projects, participate in process improvement projects as a Stakeholder of Operations Team. Assist the regional Operations team in daily BAU tasks including processing daily deposits and withdrawals and monitoring reconciliations. This is important for the executive to be up to date with the latest processes and domain knowledge. Assist the regional Operations team in resolving transactional issues leveraging data (e.g. stalled withdrawals, reconciliation discrepancies) together with the Tech team. Requirements Prior experience of 1 – 2 years of experience in writing SQL scripts and queries is required. Experience within fintech or startups or financial services spaces will be a plus point. Knowledge in Excel Macro, GSheet App Script, data dashboard creation, and other programming languages will be a plus point. Good analytical, statistical, business analysis and problem-solving skills. Able to quickly comprehend data architecture, business data and business requirements, and produce reports and dashboards to improve business efficiency. Good communication skills and attitude. Able to comprehend and communicate using basic English language skills. Expected to interact with stakeholders from various departments on a regional level regularly. Being well-organized, adaptable, and paying great attention to detail is of utmost importance. Given the daily introduction of new challenges, we are looking for someone with the intelligence and determination to tackle and adjust to changes. We value practical skills and a passion for data. Recent graduates and individuals with experience gained through self-study or coding bootcamps are welcome to apply. Benefits Employee financial and physical well-being Compensation package: You will receive a competitive total compensation package that includes employee stock options if you are a full-time employee. Comprehensive insurance coverage: Free panel outpatient GP clinic visits, group hospitalisation and surgical insurance, and Covid hospitalisation insurance coverage (conditions apply). Management fee discount: You will receive an employee discount on your asset management fees when you invest with StashAway. Flexible work arrangements and policies Unlimited paid annual leave: It should be simple for you to decide if you would like to take more or fewer days off. We trust that you are accountable for your work and know best if you need 10 or 30 days of paid annual leave that year. Personal work equipment budget: It’s important that you have a workstation that’s optimal for you wherever you are. Learning and development opportunities You will be given an annual Learning and Development budget to help you continuously learn in your pursuit of your professional and personal development. You may use the budget for resources and tools that may help you perform better at work. This budget is subject to management approval. Team bonding budget and initiatives Quarterly team bonding budget: We encourage you to socialise with colleagues across job functions, departments, and entities to know them better as individuals beyond what they professionally do. Annual off-site (Nov): Each off-site gathers all employees for a full day of company-wide team bonding activities and challenges.

Job Responsibilities: Job Summary: Become an integral part of creating an exceptional data, governance & operations ecosystem by joining the Global Analytic team as a Customer & Product Data Analyst In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be: • Review, validate and recommend master organizations and perform account maintenance/standardization to ensure accuracy • Engage closely with teams from different functions to identify and prioritize initiatives aimed at enhancing data governance and data quality. • Perform data analysis and validation to identify and resolve data quality issues and inconsistencies • Work alongside our CMDM teams to recommend changes related to new account setup and maintenance to improve process efficiencies • Partner with other areas beyond Customer Data Management to leverage data to drive key sales processes • Modify and manage data structures and compatibility logic rules of product models for NI product offerings such as Platform Systems/Advisors, Product Configurators, Accessories, and Software • Demonstrate your expertise in the field to resolve conflicts by determining appropriate data values • Monitor consistency to governance policies and procedures • Collaborate with multi-functional teams to support and validate teammate consistency to master data policies • Design and implement the best business practices for mass data updates as needed • Serve as a domain expert for account and product hierarchies, Customer Data Integration linkage, and overall governance operations • Engage with various teams to support web releases for model changes and validate success of releases. • Communicate timely and professionally to users, management, and senior leadership with repetitive issues • Develop standard procedures, user guides, and other necessary training and job aid materials • Lead and work on ad hoc regional and global projects Who You Are: You will play a critical role in maintaining and ensuring the integrity and accuracy of our product and customer master data. For this role you will be responsible for managing configuration models, understanding system constraints, and data structures delivered on ni.com through data analysis, data quality management, and product data governance. For This Role, You Will Need: • Bachelor’s degree minimum. • Prior minimum of 2 years of experience with sales operations, territories, quotes, order management and other customer datasets preferred • Proven experience (minimum 3-5 years) in product data management and data governance, preferably within a master data management team or related function • Solid analytical & problem-solving skills • Process orientation, detail focused, ability to multi-task • Ability to work with a team as well as independently • Excellent interpersonal skills; positive business relationships • Ability to create and understand SQL data queries • Ability to understand and create pseudo-code • Advanced Excel skills for data analysis and reporting • Proficiency in data visualization tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or Google Data Studio) for reporting and presenting data insights is an added advantage • Effective written and verbal communication skills in English including proper grammar Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart: Result-oriented and self-motivated Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines General/advanced understanding of business partners’ organization (Sales, Marketing, Support, BU, Services), strategy, goals and processes General/advanced understanding of governance key policies practices and procedures Seeking to understand the business need and impact for a customer and providing recommendations according to experience Clearly conveying information and ideas to individuals or groups in a manner that engages the audience and helps them retain the message Prioritizing and effectively managing one time to make sure work is completed effectively Ability to drive problems to resolution independently Demonstrating a high level of proactivity towards new tasks/projects and ability to drive them forward Our Offer To You: By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do. Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets. We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees. We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion. We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential. We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company. We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office. Location: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, Kuala Lumpur
Job Responsibilities: Are you ready to get ahead in your career? We want to empower you to turn your ambitions into achievements. We thrive in inclusiveness, diversity and embrace close collaborations for you to create impact for yourself and others. Together, we aim to bring the best of technology to help people, businesses and the nation to be ahead in a changing world. To realise our vision to become Malaysia’s leading converged solutions company, we are looking for a new talent to innovate and grow with us in a culture that values commitment, performance and possibilities. Why does this job exist and why is it critical? The Delivery Operations Controller plays a pivotal role in driving excellence across the entire delivery lifecycle by transforming operational insights into actionable strategies. This role requires a highly analytical mindset, with expertise in risk anticipation, issue management, resource optimization, and process improvement. By leveraging data as a support tool, the Controller ensures that operations are consistently optimized and that key insights are accessible to enhance decision-making across the organization. What are you accountable for? Lead initiatives to streamline delivery operations, reduce bottlenecks, and improve productivity. Develop frameworks for continuous improvement, ensuring alignment with business objectives. Set standards for operational performance, establishing governance practices and monitoring key metrics to maintain alignment with organizational goals and best practices. Analyze operational data to identify trends, inefficiencies, and opportunities for optimization across delivery processes, providing actionable insights to support efficiency. Partner with cross-functional teams to gather, organize, and streamline data from diverse sources, ensuring accuracy, relevance, and alignment with business intelligence goals. Establish clear data requirements and continuous feedback loops to enhance data-driven decision-making. Develop and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards and reports to provide visually clear and actionable insights that support informed decision-making, following best practices in data visualization and user experience. Transform raw data from sources such as databases, APIs, and Excel into structured, insightful reports. Use Power BI for data modelling and integration, simplifying complex data for actionable insights. Design and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards and reports, prioritizing clarity and relevance to support informed decision-making. Apply best practices in data visualization to enhance user experience and insight accessibility. Lead training initiatives to improve data entry, structure, and usage across teams, facilitating efficient use within Power BI models. Provide clear guidelines and training sessions to support data accuracy and reliability. What do you need for the role? No formal education requirement, provided the candidate is an expert in Power BI and can create high-quality, actionable dashboards. 2-3 years of hands-on experience with Power BI (or exceptional skills demonstrated through project work for fresh graduates). Strong proficiency in Power BI, including DAX queries, Power Query, and data modelling. Proven ability to transform complex data into clear, actionable insights that support business decision-making. Familiarity with Power Automate, Power Apps, and API integration for enhanced automation. Experience with databases, such as SQL Server or Azure, for data sourcing and integration. Knowledge of data warehousing and ETL processes (preferred). Advanced data visualization and storytelling skills. Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving capabilities. Excellent communication skills for effectively collaborating with stakeholders and presenting insights. Ability to independently manage multiple priorities and projects. Familiarity with report optimization best practices and ensuring data consistency. Attention to detail and strong organizational skills. What’s next? Once you’ve applied online, our team will carefully review your application. Due to a high volume of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a fair and timely review process. Should you be shortlisted for the role, we will send you an invitation via email for a digital interview. You can also check on your application status by logging into your candidate account. Maxis values diverse voices & people. We hire and reward our employees based on capability & performance — regardless of ethnicity, gender, age, education, religion, nationality or physical ability.

Are you a passionate IT professional with a knack for leadership, project management, and data-driven solutions? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where you can drive innovation and deliver results? If so, we want you on our team! At Nando’s, our IT department is enabling seamless operations and empowering data-driven decision-making. We’re looking for a talented and experienced IT Professional to join our team and play a key role in leading projects, optimizing data pipelines, and driving technical excellence. This is your opportunity to: Lead and mentor a dynamic team while collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders. Manage high-impact projects that drive business growth and innovation. Design and implement cutting-edge data solutions that transform how we use data. Work in a supportive, fast-paced environment where your skills and ideas will make a real difference. What you’ll do: Team Leadership: Lead, mentor, and manage team members, third-party suppliers, and project teams to achieve common goals. Foster a positive and collaborative work environment that encourages innovation and productivity. Set clear goals, provide regular feedback, and coach team members to ensure success. Project Management: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to plan, scope, and execute business-enabling projects. Define project timelines, resources, and budgets, ensuring deliverables are completed on time and within scope. Manage third-party vendors to ensure tasks, timelines, and budgets are adhered to. Data Pipeline Development & Integration: Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines for collecting, processing, and integrating large datasets. Implement best practices to ensure high performance, reliability, and scalability across data workflows. Develop Python/SQL scripts for ETL processes, data cleansing, and real-time API integrations. Database Management & Optimization: Ensure databases are secure, high-performing, and highly available. Optimize queries and indexing for efficient data retrieval and seamless integration. Collaboration & Support: Act as a liaison between stakeholders and solution providers to assess feasibility and alignment of solutions. Provide cross-functional support to integrate and maintain solutions that meet business needs. Collaborate with technical teams across IT and network departments to deliver impactful results. IT Testing & Implementation: Participate in defining, testing, training, and implementing functional requirements. Evaluate approaches for integrating cloud applications into enterprise systems. Manage change requests and project requirements to ensure timely delivery within scope. User Training & Application Support: Provide guidance and support to end-users on software applications, configurations, and troubleshooting. Assist with software and hardware setup, optimizing user experience and addressing technical concerns. What We’re Looking For: A Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, or a related field. 5–8 years of experience in IT project management, data integration, or related fields. Proven experience in database management, cloud computing (e.g., MS Azure), and programming (Python, SQL, Java, or Scala). Strong leadership skills with experience managing teams and third-party vendors. Passion for leveraging data for decision-making and driving business outcomes. Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills with a continuous improvement mindset. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across all levels of the organization. Ability to work under pressure, meet tight deadlines, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. Proficiency in MS Excel, Python, SQL, and Power BI (preferred). Independent, self-starter, and a strong team player. Polite, thoughtful, and friendly attitude with a focus on delivering results. Fluency in English and Bahasa Malaysia for business correspondence. As Nando’s continues to grow and evolve, we’re expanding our IT team to drive innovation and improve efficiency. This new role reflect our commitment to investing in technology and talent to create seamless and efficient experiences for our teams and customers. If you’re ready to take on a challenging and rewarding role where you can lead, innovate, and make an impact, apply now and join our team!

What you'll be doing Data Analysis, Operations, and Department Management: Take charge of the department's data management, including order and revenue forecasting, and PPL (Post-Production Labor) management. This role requires a deep understanding of operational metrics to drive efficiency and performance. Order and Revenue Forecasting: Identify potential delays and risks in progress, analyze underlying issues, and propose proactive solutions. Conduct regular reviews to expose risks, ensuring continuous improvement in forecasting accuracy and operational success. PPL Management: Optimize the management of PPL based on order and revenue forecasts. Focus on modules with slow progress or negative YoY growth by conducting thorough reviews and providing high-quality support to drive performance improvements. 2. Operational Excellence and Efficiency Play a key role in improving organizational efficiency by implementing strategies that streamline operations and enhance team productivity. Ensure smooth management of key tasks and drive business objectives forward. Improving Operational Efficiency: Develop and execute detailed plans that align with the department’s goals. Regularly review plans with supervisors to track progress, identify risks, and ensure successful outcomes. Conduct in-depth risk assessments and provide actionable next steps to mitigate challenges. Management of Key Departmental Tasks: Lead the management and progress of high-priority tasks within the department. Focus on identifying and addressing issues early, ensuring continuous progress towards achieving departmental goals. Closed-Loop Task Management: Ensure that outstanding tasks are handled in a structured, efficient manner, helping to address key operational issues and significantly improve team performance and efficiency. Organizing Departmental Meetings: Coordinate regular department meetings to review progress, uncover potential risks, and facilitate timely resolution of business challenges. Ensure comprehensive meeting documentation and follow-through. 3. Labor Hours and Expertise Management Assist in managing the department’s labor hours and expertise, ensuring optimal resource allocation. Play a pivotal role in supporting the Solution Performance Committee’s initiatives and goals. What we're looking for Bachelor’s degree or higher in ICT-related fields or business-related majors or equivalent (e.g., Electrical & Electronic Engineering, Telecommunications, Computer Science, HR, Business Administration, etc.). Comprehensive understanding of the solutions business within the enterprise ICT industry. Team player, self-motivated, result-oriented, and able to work independently with minimal supervision. Knowledge of the ICT environment, strategic partnerships for solutions, and industry/business trends, enabling effective solution development, is an advantage. Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively with mid to senior-level clients and internal teams across different geographies and cultures. Previous experience as an Operations Engineer or Specialist is considered a plus. Willingness to travel for business within the Asia Pacific region. What we hope you're good with Exceptional Communication and Teamwork Skills: Proven ability to articulate ideas clearly and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Strong interpersonal skills are essential for fostering a cooperative work environment. Goal-Oriented Process Management: Demonstrated ability to drive results, manage complex workflows, and ensure team alignment with business objectives. Proficiency in Data Analysis: Strong analytical skills, with advanced proficiency in Excel and other data analysis tools to track performance, generate insights, and support decision-making. Multitasking and Time Management: Ability to juggle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment, while maintaining attention to detail and meeting deadlines. What we offer We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package, and opportunities for professional development and career growth. Our dynamic and inclusive work environment encourages innovation and collaboration, allowing you to make a meaningful impact on the future of telecommunications.

Provide technical consultancy to application developers and project matters. Requirements: Possess Diploma or Bachelor's Degree in Computer Engineering/Computer Science/Information Technology or equivalent At least 1-2 years of experience as a Database Engineer/Administrator Experience with MySQL/MariaDB master-slave replication, read/write separation, database proxy and cluster as high-availability solutions Experience in database infrastructure and architecture design. Experience in database optimization and performance tuning. Experience with backup and restore, tablespace allocation/management, managing the overall health and status for database. Job Summary: Our client, a leading MNC based in Petaling Jaya, Selangor, is seeking a Senior Financial Data Analyst with strong technical expertise to enhance financial reporting processes, optimize data flow, and support business decision-making through automation and analytics. This role requires a deep understanding of databases, financial systems, and data structures to drive improvements in financial reporting, reconciliation, and process efficiency. The ideal candidate will focus on refining financial reporting and analytics capabilities post-ERP implementation, ensuring data integrity, automation, and improved insights for accounting, FP&A, and business operations. Additionally, this role will support revenue recognition analysis and compliance by ensuring accurate data capture and alignment with ASC 606 standards. Job Responsibilities: •Refine and optimize financial reporting processes post-ERP implementation to improve efficiency and accuracy. •Analyze and enhance financial data flows, database structures, and reporting frameworks across various systems. •Develop and maintain automated financial dashboards and reports using Power BI, SQL, and Alteryx. •Collaborate with Accounting, FP&A, and IT teams to improve data integrity, reconciliation processes, and reporting automation. •Ensure seamless data integration between financial systems, identifying and resolving discrepancies. •Assist with revenue recognition analysis, ensuring data is properly structured and aligned with ASC 606 compliance requirements. •Identify and implement process automation opportunities to streamline workflows and improve reporting timelines. •Ensure compliance with US GAAP and financial reporting standards, with a strong focus on audit readiness and controls. •Maintain and update technical documentation for reporting structures, data flows, and automation workflows. Qualifications: •4+ years of experience in financial data analysis, data engineering, or a related field. •Strong SQL skills and experience working with large financial datasets. •Hands-on experience with financial reporting tools (Power BI, Tableau, or similar) and ETL tools (Alteryx or equivalent). •Understanding of financial accounting principles, particularly US GAAP and ASC 606 revenue recognition. •Experience with ERP systems (Microsoft D365 preferred) and financial data integration. •Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a data-driven mindset. •Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. •Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable business insights. •Fluent in both spoken and written English. This role is ideal for a technically inclined financial professional who enjoys working with data, refining financial reporting processes, and ensuring compliance with revenue recognition standards to drive business performance. Share resumes : mehak.bhola@accordinnovations.com

Company Name: McDonald's Malaysia- Gerbang Alaf Restaurants Sdn Bhd
Job Responsibilities: Job responsibilities: DevOps Related: Automating database provisioning, deployments, and configuration management. Integrating database changes into CI/CD pipelines to ensure continuous delivery of new database features or patches. Monitoring database performance and health through Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools, ensuring databases are part of an automated cloud environment. API Related: Develop, support and optimize databases for API based data extraction, ensuring fast and efficient queries that meet API performance needs. Work with Data Engineer to create efficient database queries for data ingestion through RESTful endpoints. Implement APIs for Database-as-a-Service (DBaaS), allowing automated provisioning and querying of databases through API calls. Security related: Implement database-level encryption (for both at rest and in transit) to protect sensitive data. Manage role-based access control (RBAC) and user privileges to ensure that only authorized users can access or modify data. Monitor databases for unauthorized access, SQL injection, and other vulnerabilities. Apply security patches and updates to databases to ensure protection from known exploits. Data Governance /DQ Related: Implement data validation and quality checks within the database to ensure data consistency, completeness, and accuracy. Monitor data quality through profiling and integrity checks, identifying issues like duplicate records, missing values, or incorrect formats. Collaborate with Data Engineer to design databases that support DQ initiatives (e.g., avoiding nulls, enforcing foreign key constraints). Skills: Database Management: Expertise in relational databases such as SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, and PostgreSQL, as well as NoSQL databases like MongoDB and Cassandra. Proficient in managing cloud-based DBaaS platforms, including from AWS, GCP and Azure. SQL Proficiency: Skilled in writing and optimizing SQL queries, stored procedures, and managing database schemas to support high-performance operations. Backup & Recovery: Implementing robust backup strategies and disaster recovery plans to ensure high availability and data integrity. Performance Tuning: Expertise in optimizing database performance through query tuning, indexing, and effective resource management. Security & Access Control: Managing user roles and permissions, ensuring data security through encryption methods (e.g., TDE, SSL/TLS), and implementing strong access controls with tools like LDAP, OAuth, and Active Directory. API Management: Expertise in optimizing SQL queries for APIs that serve high-volume requests and in managing databases exposed through APIs such as MySQL REST API, Postgres JSON support, and GraphQL. Familiar with API testing and documentation tools like Postman, Swagger, and OpenAPI, and experienced in using database connectors like ODBC, JDBC, and Python DB-API. Data Encryption & Vulnerability Management: Proficient in implementing data encryption strategies (e.g., TDE, SSL/TLS) and conducting vulnerability management to mitigate risks like SQL injection and privilege escalation. Knowledgeable in database auditing using tools like AWS CloudTrail, SQL Server Audit, and Oracle Audit Vault. Data Governance & Data Quality (DQ): Experienced in data profiling using tools for SQL queries to ensure data integrity and consistency. Proficient in using data governance solutions, and in setting up error logging and data cleansing workflows in ETL/ELT pipelines. Expertise in enforcing data integrity with database constraints like foreign keys, uniqueness, and check constraints. Cloud Infrastructure: Strong background in cloud platforms including AWS, Azure, and GCP, with extensive experience in managing cloud databases and leveraging cloud-native services for optimal database management. Generative AI & Automation: Leveraging AI for database optimization, such as automated query performance improvements, synthetic data generation for testing, and AI-driven database documentation and schema design based on historical usage patterns. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field. Master's degree preferred. 5+ years of experience in data management and governance Experience with database systems (SQL Server, Oracle, etc.) and data modeling. Strong understanding of data governance, Master Data Management principles and practices. Experience with data management tools and technologies. Excellent project management, problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail. Strong experience with data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts. Solid understanding of database management systems (e.g., SQL, NoSQL) and data integration techniques. Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP). Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team. Strong communication skills to effectively interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Job Description: Job Summary: As a Business Operations Analyst, you will play a critical role in optimizing and streamlining our business processes to support growth and operational excellence. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze business performance, identify opportunities for improvement, and implement solutions that enhance efficiency and effectiveness in our semiconductor operations. Key Responsibilities: Data Analysis and Reporting: Collect, analyze, and interpret complex data related to business operations, including production, supply chain, and sales performance. Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights to management and stakeholders. Monitor sales and forecast trends to identify booking opportunities Assist in the development and execution of business strategies and operational plans. Process Improvement: Evaluate existing business processes and identify opportunities for optimization and automation. Collaborate with departments to design and implement process improvements that enhance productivity and reduce costs. Documentation and Training: Document business processes, procedures, and best practices to ensure consistency and compliance. Develop training materials and conduct training sessions for employees on new processes or systems. Qualifications: Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Operations Management or Finance,. Experience: 8+ years of experience in business operations, finance or a related field, preferably within the semiconductor or manufacturing industry. Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data. Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, BI tools). Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate effectively Knowledge of semiconductor manufacturing processes and industry best practices. Working Conditions: Office-based role with occasional travel May require working outside regular business hours to support operational needs or projects Broadcom is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We will consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability status, medical condition, pregnancy, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. We will also consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records consistent with local law. If you are located outside USA, please be sure to fill out a home address as this will be used for future correspondence.

Location: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, Kuala Lumpur
Job Responsibilities: Position Title Manager, Business Intelligence Reports To Senior Manager, Business Intelligence Role Purpose Support and enhance existing commercial BI systems and its underlying databases and drive enhancement for Commercial Reporting Portal in order for commercial team to define, control and monitor commercial key performance indicators that are required in achieving the annual revenue target. Key Accountability Working with the Commercial Business Analyst and the BI Team, to design dashboards and solutions to address the commercial management’s needs. The dashboards will in turn help the management monitor the commercial KPIs and help identify gaps. Undertake DBA (database administration) function of existing system and ensure databases are organized and structured effectively, secured from unauthorized access, perform data backups and capacity planning implement data quality mechanisms in existing data structures. Bring innovative business intelligence (BI) technologies like mobile BI, big data, predictive technology, and data mining to MAS which includes able to perform research and explain data quality issues by building mechanisms to effectively report on data quality issues to stake holders. Direct and manage the optimization process of Revenue planning by developing Linear programming models using advanced operations research techniques to obtain the optimal traffic mix for the commercial sales revenue targets via external revenue planning tools. Work to improve the efficiency and the functionality of current systems by coordinating various business improvement initiatives by applying excellent analytical and problem resolution skills. Understand requirements of requests received and that they are assigned and completed within the agreed timeframe. Qualifications Minimum Bachelor’s Degree with 5 – 7 years with minimum 2 years in managerial position Skill & Knowledge SQL Microsoft Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) PowerBI Key Challenges Meticulous and attentive to details, able to communicate with all levels of stakeholders, junior and senior, quick to respond to queries and manage expectations.

The position reports to the Chief Operations Officer Job Overview: We are seeking a Process Governance Senior Specialist who will play a key role in delivering our department's mandate and the business division's ambitions. As the specialist, you will be responsible for managing, supporting, guiding, mentoring, and ensuring the timely and efficient delivery output of various streams including Customer Service, Technology, Product, Billing, Finance, Sales and Customer Management as well as within Retail Operations. You will have end-to-end accountability to achieve agreed benchmarks and compliance standards set forth by the company, division, and department. Responsibilities: Act as a problem solver with a strong understanding of the importance of providing the best customer experience. You should be result-oriented, process-driven, and committed to delivering best-in-class quality with quick and effortless service delivery through active engagement with all counterparts. Collaborate with teams across the organization to ideate, align and document and processes in key areas across functions, including analysing change impact. Identify, drive and deliver business process improvements that streamline activities, ensure robustness and compliance, increase quality and efficiency, and represent best practices, involving Change Management activities, such as training and communicating changes Be responsive to all tasks and matters directed to you through various communication channels (emails, calls, SMS, WhatsApp, Zoom, etc.). Provide immediate attention to sort, resolve, address, and close matters/tasks with quality and urgency based on business requirements. Contribute to the organization's value creation and exemplify TIME leadership expectations, including being passionate about the business, encouraging change and continuous improvement, ensuring excellent execution, maintaining integrity and accountability, being curious and engaging with teams, being decisive and action-oriented, being courageous and innovative, and being resourceful and results-oriented. Your work life: Accountable and well versed in the Organisation’s processes and procedures. Map and assess processes and ways of working across the key functions in Operations. Identify process improvements, redesign processes using lean principles, and ensure compliance with best practices, regulatory standards. Develop and implement process controls, monitoring, optimization, and continuous improvement tools. Highly involved in product briefing, PPV and UAT activities to support system/product/promotion launches. Collaborate with operations teams to consolidate operational processes and system user requirements. Produce and track users’ requirements specification (URS), work closely with IT PMO on URS status and timeline, conduct testing, and monitor stability periods. Analyze operational data, and turn into insight and action plans. Produce KPI, performance related reporting with action plans to improve to management. Perform other tasks assigned by management. To be considered, you’ll need: Bachelor's degree in Finance, Telecommunications, Business Management, Information Systems, or Engineering 5 years of working experience in a relevant role. Technology expertise, Lean Six Sigma, Business Process Improvement (BPI), CMMI, and Microsoft Visio skills would be an added advantage. Strong attention to detail and understanding of processes and systems. Comfortable with intense operational work and highly customer-oriented. Proactive with initiative and a creative problem-solving mindset. Ability to multitask, prioritize assignments, and manage time effectively. Excellent communication skills at all levels. Customer-focused mindset and ability to anticipate and mitigate problems. Take-lead mentality and commitment to delivering on the mandate. Location: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, Kuala Lumpur
Job Responsibilities: The Assistant Shift Lead will play a critical role in ensuring the smooth and efficient execution of batch processing tasks within our data center environment. This position involves monitoring, controlling, and maintaining batch processing systems, performing routine checks, addressing technical issues, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure the timely delivery of processed data to our clients. • Proven experience as a Data Center Operator or similar role, with specific exposure to batch processing operations. • Familiarity with batch processing tools, such as A-Auto (Mainframe tool), ASG ZENA scheduler (to monitor FTP & Batches) or similar. • Proficiency in working with mainframe systems and open systems. • Knowledge of IT infrastructure components, including servers (VMWare), storage systems (Veritas NetBackup monitoring), and to use putty for Unix related tasks. To work on a rotating shift schedule (2 shift cycle/ 12 hours shift), including weekends and holidays, to ensure 24/7 coverage of batch processing operations. Coordinate and delegate tasks among team members to ensure smooth operation during day-end processing. • Supervise the execution of day-end processing procedures, ensuring accuracy and timeliness in data handling, backups, and other critical tasks. • Address any issues or challenges that arise during day-end processing promptly and effectively, either by resolving them directly or escalating them to appropriate personnel. • Monitor system performance and data integrity throughout the day-end processing period and generate reports detailing any anomalies or discrepancies for further investigation. • Manage resources such as personnel, equipment, and supplies effectively to optimize workflow and ensure the successful completion of day-end processing tasks. • Ensure that day-end processing activities comply with relevant regulations, standards, and security protocols to protect sensitive data and maintain regulatory compliance. • Maintain accurate records and documentation of day-end processing activities, including procedures, logs, and incident reports, to support auditing and continuous improvement efforts. • Provide training and guidance to team members to enhance their skills and knowledge related to day-end processing procedures and best practices. • Facilitate clear and timely communication with stakeholders, including management, other departments, and external partners, to keep them informed of day-end processing status and any relevant issues. • Identify opportunities for process improvements and efficiency gains in day-end processing operations, and collaborate with team members and other stakeholders to implement changes effectively.

Sector: Records Management & Document Control (Administration & Office Support)
Job Responsibilities: Change people's lives and love what you do! Cochlear develops world-leading medical devices that help people hear. As a top 100 medical device company and market-leader in implantable hearing devices, more people choose a Cochlear-branded cochlear implant system than any other. Our employees tell us that the number one reason they enjoy working for Cochlear is the opportunity to make a difference to people's lives. The purpose of the Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) Configuration Controller is to provide support to the PLM users, collect metrics, generate reports, audit and maintain data and facilitate the implementation of promotions and product changes. This will enable Cochlear to meet its regulatory and commercial objectives. The PLM Configuration Controller contributes to a geographically dispersed Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) Configuration Management Team that has global responsibility for setting, maintaining and enforcing product configuration and change management standards across Cochlear. Key Responsibilities Accountability 1: PLM System and User Support Manage PLM user issues, working with the Configuration Management Team to prioritize and resolve user service calls. Monitor and track problems with the completion PLM system tasks. Support and work with the PLM users to prioritize the completion of tasks and help ensure a smooth progression of product promotions and changes from proposal to implementation. Assist with the development of training material to support the users of the PLM system and the Configuration Management Team. Assist the PLM users to ensure the integrity of the data in the PLM system is maintained and soft copy documents stored in accordance with our standards and procedures. Manage PLM user issues, working with the Configuration Management Team to prioritize and resolve user service calls. Complete any assigned workflow tasks for the creation of new review workflows in the PLM System, conducting part and document quality checks and the correct review team is assigned, ensuring compliance with our standards and procedures. Provide support to PLM system users on the correct use of the PLM system. Be a PLM system super user who provides support and expert advice to other users. Accountability 2: Collect PLM Metrics and Generate Reports Define the PLM metrics and collection method requirements for the PLM System. Generate and distribute regular reports from the PLM System that provide visibility on the status of open workflows. Generate and distribute metrics that indicate the status of data and efficiency of the system use. Provide visibility of the success or failure against defined KPIs. Generate and distribute other reports from the PLM System on request. Assist the PLM Configuration Management Team Lead in the design of new reports that can be generated from the PLM System. Accountability 3: Audit and Maintain the PLM System Data Support and work with the PLM users to ensure the integrity of the data in the PLM system is maintained and soft copy documents stored in accordance with the relevant standards and procedure. Assist in the conduct of audits of the data within the PLM system to identify areas requiring correction or improvement, such as duplicates, incomplete records, missing documents or approvals. Support and work with the Configuration Management Team and PLM users to make corrections to the data in the PLM system to ensure compliance with the relevant standards and procedures. Remediate system data to ensure it aligns with current standards and practices. Accountability 4: PLM Implementation of Promotions and Changes Ensure that product implementation into the ERP Systems completed and maintained in accordance with the relevant approved procedures. Work with all departments and the Configuration Management Team to support the ongoing use of the PLM system and ERP implementation activities. Support and work with the Configuration Management Team to prioritize activities and help ensure a smooth progression of product promotions and changes from proposal to implementation. Complete any assigned workflow tasks to route the promotion or change for implementation activities. Accountability 5: PLM Configuration Management Activity Management Support the Configuration Management Team to resolve Cochlear Service Portal Calls that are related to the PLM system. Be responsible for the overall performance of one or more Configuration Management activities as assigned. Collaborate with other team members to ensure that the assigned activities are being managed and completed within the required timeframes and to the required level of quality. Report progress or issues to the PLM Configuration Management Lead. Provide support to the Configuration Management Team Lead in identifying and applying any specific project related configuration management requirements. Complete other configuration management activities as required. Key Requirements: Possess minimum of Bachelor education in any related field with minimum 2 years of relevant experience as a document controller or similar in any industry. Knowledge in change management and document control would be highly preferable with the exposure of working within multinational company. Experience with PLM tools i.e PPM, Windchill and Jama would be ideal to have. Must be computer literate especially in the usage of MS Office applications. Attention to detail as this role would highly involve proofreading in a structured format. Strong communication skills with the ability to write clear and concise email as well as managing difficult conversation at any level. Experience working with product development configuration and change processes. Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively at different levels of the organization and across functional disciplines. Expertise in configuration and change management in a product development environment. Comfortable to work in a rotational shift pattern in Bangsar South; further information to be shared upon confirmation to progress further. Cochlear Malaysia provides shared services to support Cochlear's global operations. The growing team of professionals in Malaysia provides critical support in areas such as IT infrastructure and applications, development and testing, business intelligence development and support, procurement, customer service, service and repairs and returned device analysis engineering. If you feel that you have the skills and experience to be successful in this role and take on new challenges to build your career with Cochlear, please start your application by clicking the apply button below.

Roche fosters diversity, equity and inclusion, representing the communities we serve. When dealing with healthcare on a global scale, diversity is an essential ingredient to success. We believe that inclusion is key to understanding people’s varied healthcare needs. Together, we embrace individuality and share a passion for exceptional care. Join Roche, where every voice matters. The Position We are seeking a Data Engineer to join our pharmaceutical company’s data team. This role is essential in building, optimizing, and maintaining scalable data infrastructure to support data science, analytics, and business intelligence initiatives. The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in cloud platforms (AWS), Python programming, and modern data engineering tools such as Snowflake and dbt. Additionally, the candidate should have experience in database performance analysis, troubleshooting, and IT system implementation to enhance data quality and flow within the organization. This position offers a unique opportunity to work with large-scale pharmaceutical and healthcare datasets, ensuring secure, compliant, and efficient data operations. At higher job levels, the candidate may contribute to the development and architecture of enterprise-wide IT solutions. As a qualified Data Engineer, your key accountabilities;- Data Engineering & Infrastructure • Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL/ELT processes for structured and unstructured data. • Implement data models in Snowflake for efficient data storage, retrieval, and analytics. • Utilize dbt for data transformation, modeling, and governance. • Develop and maintain AWS-based data infrastructure (e.g., S3, Lambda, Glue, Redshift). • Optimize database performance, troubleshoot issues, and enhance data flow patterns. • Plan, design, and implement systems and infrastructures for improved data quality. System & IT Support for Data Science Projects • Support data science and analytics teams by ensuring high-quality, well-structured data availability. • Perform IT functions, including system design, analysis, testing, debugging, and implementation of applications for data science projects. • Analyze, install, modify, and support operating systems, databases, and utilities software to enhance data processing capabilities. • Plan and conduct business problem analysis to be solved with automated data systems. Process & System Optimization • Analyze and design improved data flow across the organization, ensuring efficiency and scalability. • Implement data governance and security measures to comply with pharmaceutical regulations. • Automate and orchestrate workflows using Airflow, Prefect, or similar orchestration tools. • Contribute to the development, testing, and evaluation of IT infrastructure architecture, particularly in higher-level roles. Who You Are • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or a related field. • 3+ years of experience in data engineering or a related IT field. • Strong proficiency in Python for data processing and automation. • Hands-on experience with AWS cloud services (S3, Lambda, Glue, Redshift, etc.). • Experience with Snowflake for data warehousing and dbt for data transformations. • Proficiency in SQL for database design, optimization, and troubleshooting. • Knowledge of data orchestration tools (Airflow, Prefect, etc.). • Experience in IT system analysis, testing, and implementation related to data science projects. • Understanding of data governance, security, and regulatory compliance in the pharmaceutical industry. Who we are At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity. The Roche Services & Solutions as well as People Support Solutions organisations located in Kuala Lumpur provide end-to-end business solutions for Finance, Procurement, IT, Communications, People & Culture (Human Resources) and beyond to our Roche colleagues across the APAC region. Today Roche employs altogether around 1100 employees in Malaysia. Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Technology Adoption: Identify, evaluate, and implement emerging technologies (e.g., AI, blockchain, cloud computing, automation, data analytics) to optimize financial operations. Process Optimization: Streamline financial processes through automation, AI-driven analytics, and data-driven decision-making. Customer Experience Enhancement: Improve digital banking, payments, and customer engagement strategies using innovative technologies. Stakeholder Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams, including IT, finance, risk, compliance, and operations, to ensure seamless digital integration. Change Management: Lead organizational change initiatives, ensuring smooth adoption of new digital tools and methodologies. Regulatory Compliance & Risk Management: Ensure digital initiatives comply with financial regulations and industry standards. Performance Monitoring: Track KPIs, measure digital transformation success, and adjust strategies as needed. Required Skills & Qualifications: Education: Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Finance, Business, IT, or related fields. Experience: 7+ years of experience in financial services, digital transformation, or technology-driven roles. Through proprietary software and AI, along with a focus on customer delight, Sleek makes the back-office easy for micro SMEs. We give Entrepreneurs time back to focus on what they love doing - growing their business and being with customers. With a surging number of Entrepreneurs globally, we are innovating in a highly lucrative space. We operate 3 business segments: Corporate Secretary: Automating the company incorporation, secretarial, filing, Nominee Director, mailroom and immigration processes via custom online robots and SleekSign. We are the market leaders in Singapore with ~5% market share of all new business incorporations Accounting & Bookkeeping: Redefining what it means to do Accounting, Bookkeeping, Tax and Payroll thanks to our proprietary SleekBooks ledger, AI tools and exceptional customer service FinTech payments: Overcoming a key challenge for Entrepreneurs by offering digital banking services to new businesses Sleek launched in 2017 and now has around 15,000 customers across our offices in Singapore, Hong Kong, Australia and the UK. We have around 450 staff with an intact startup mindset. We have achieved >70% compound annual growth in Revenue over the last 5 years and as a result have been recognised by The Financial Times, The Straits Times, Forbes and LinkedIn as one of the fastest growing companies in Asia. Backed by world-class investors, we are on track to be one of the few cash flow positive, tech-enabled unicorns based out of Singapore. Requirements We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst that is excited about the below Mission and Outcomes over the next 6-12 months. Mission: Drive informed decision making within the COO’s organization by turning data from our Accounting, Corporate Secretary, FinTech and Compliance operations into actionable insights that improve the robustness and profitability of Sleek’s operations. Outcomes: 1/ Data reliability Ensuring that your analysis is at least 90% accurate, with clear understanding and explanation of what causes the 10% gap. 2/ Dashboard creation and management - Visualizing data in Looker Studio or Tableau, in a way that is clear and concise - Calculation of metrics are to be consistent with existing dashboards - Dashboards are to be prototyped with the end user in Google Sheets before created - Efficient/ scalable solutions to be proposed to ensure long-term sustainability of dashboards - Dashboard usage is to be reviewed every quarter those with low utilization are to be archived 3/ Documentation Ensure all key metrics and calculations are clearly documented in Google Docs and pinned/ linked in our internal Wiki or Slack channels. Language should be accessible to other Data Analysts and non-technical stakeholders. 4/ Data quality recommendations Work with Tech, Product and Data Engineers to ensure data pipelines are robust and efficient, so that Big Query is maintained as best as possible. 5/ Collaborate with other Data Analysts Even though you’ll be embedded within the functional team and working independently, you’ll need to contribute to an inclusive, friendly, knowledge sharing culture with other DAs, so that everyone is aware of each other's workstreams/ sprints, challenges and learnings. To do this, you will have a minimum of 5 years experience as a Data Analyst. The interview process The successful candidate will participate in the below interview stages (note that the order might be different to what you read below). We anticipate the process to last no more than 3 weeks from start to finish. Whether the interviews are held over video call or in person will depend on your location and the role. Case study A ~60 minute chat with the Hiring Manager (COO) or CFO and 1-2 other Data Analysts, where they will give you some real-life challenges that this role faces, and will ask for your approach to solving them. Career deep dive A ~60 minute chat with the Hiring Manager (COO). They’ll discuss your last 1-2 roles to understand your experience in more detail. Behavioural fit assessment A ~60 minute chat with our Head of HR or the CFO, where they will dive into some of your recent work situations to understand how you think and work. Offer + reference interviews - We’ll make a non-binding offer verbally or over email, followed by a couple of short phone or video calls with references that you provide to us. - We are offering SGD 3,000 to SGD 4,000 monthly remuneration for this role, along with the other financial, wellbeing and lifestyle benefits mentioned earlier in the job description. Requirement for background screening Please be aware that Sleek is a regulated entity and as such is required to perform different levels of background checks on staff depending on their role. This may include using external vendors to verify the below: Your education Any criminal history Any political exposure Any bankruptcy or adverse credit history We will ask for your consent before conducting these checks. Depending on your role at Sleek, an adverse result on one of these checks may prohibit you from passing probation. By submitting a job application, you confirm that you have read and agree to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates, found at sleek.com. Benefits some other great things about working at Sleek... Humility and kindness: Humility is a core attribute we hire for, which means we have a culture of not taking ourselves too seriously and being able to laugh. Kindness is also incredibly important. We are committed to creating and nurturing a diverse and inclusive environment. Flexibility: You’ll be able to work from home 2-3 days per week if you live in Singapore or Hong Kong, or 5 days per week if you’re fully remote. If you need to start early or start late to cater to your family or other needs, we don’t mind, so long as you get your work done and proactively communicate. You can also work fully remote from anywhere in the world for 1 month each year Financial benefits: We pay competitive market salaries and provide staff with generous paid time off and holiday schedules. Additionally, you’ll be able to access our flexi benefits scheme for home office equipment or health and fitness expenditure. Certain staff at Sleek are also eligible for our employee share ownership plan and can share in the upside of our stellar growth trajectory as we work toward listing on a prominent stock exchange in the Asia Pacific region. Personal growth: You’ll get a lot of responsibility and autonomy at Sleek - we move at a fast pace so you’ll be making decisions, making mistakes and learning. There’s also a range of internal and external facing training programmes we run. We’re also at the forefront of utilizing AI in our space and are developing a regional center of AI excellence. It is our intention that if you leave Sleek, you leave as a more well-rounded person and professional. Sleek is also a proudly certified B Corp: Since we started our journey in 2017, we’ve been committed to building Sleek as a force for good. In just over 5 years, we’ve joined a community of industry leaders like Patagonia, Ben & Jerry's, and P&G who are building an inclusive, equitable, and a regenerative economy. We have planted over 29,271 trees to reforest our ecosystem and saved 7 tons of paper from landfills by processing over 1.4M pages through Sleek Sign. We aim to be Carbon Neutral by 2030.

Job Responsibilities: Responsibilities About TikTok TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. Why Join Us Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. Join us. The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures TikTok users have a safe experience while viewing advertisements. They work closely with advertisers to create ad policies, manage content review processes, and more. As we continue to add advertising on TikTok, this team is critical in assuring a joyful and creative ads experience for the community. The Team Leader will oversee a team of Data Understanding Specialists (DUS), providing hands-on guidance and support in operational execution and project delivery. This role focuses on day-to-day team management, ensuring that projects are delivered efficiently while maintaining high-quality standards. The ideal candidate will have experience in both operations and cross-functional project management, helping to bridge teams, drive progress, and support the professional growth of their direct reports. Key Responsibilities: 1. Team Supervision & Support: Oversee the daily work of Data Understanding Specialists, ensuring adherence to processes, timelines, and quality standards. Provide mentorship and on-the-job training to team members, fostering their growth and technical development. Act as a point of escalation for challenges encountered by the team, offering solutions and guidance. 2. Operational Efficiency: Assist in executing operational strategies to optimize workflow and team efficiency. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support process improvements, tool enhancements, and system upgrades. Ensure proper tracking of project KPIs and metrics, regularly reviewing performance to maintain alignment with business goals. 3. Project Support & Coordination: Facilitate the delivery of cross-functional projects, ensuring that Data Understanding Specialists contribute effectively to project goals. Help maintain the project roadmap, assisting in prioritizing tasks and managing dependencies. Coordinate with senior leadership to communicate team progress, blockers, and any needed resources. 4. Process Improvement: Actively participate in identifying opportunities to streamline processes and improve data-driven decision-making. Support the implementation of project management tools and processes to enhance the efficiency of both the team and larger initiatives. Encourage a mindset of continuous improvement within the team. 5. Stakeholder Communication: Serve as the primary liaison between Data Understanding Specialists and other operational and technical teams, ensuring effective collaboration. Communicate key updates, progress, and issues to both team members and leadership, maintaining transparency. Qualifications Minimum qualifications: 1. Experience managing or leading teams within an operational or project management setting. 2. Strong organizational and multitasking skills with a proven ability to manage complex, cross-functional projects. 3. Ability to provide mentorship and training to a team, fostering growth and maintaining high performance. Preferred qualifications:: 1. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively work with both internal teams and external stakeholders. 2. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with an emphasis on data-driven decision-making.
