Job Title: Senior/Operations Executive, ePension (HK Support) Up to RM5,500
Company Name: iFAST Global Hub AI Sdn Bhd
Job Responsibilities: About us: At ePension, we’re driving the future of retirement savings by transitioning the administration process into streamlined, digital platform. We’re looking for passionate, detail-oriented individuals to join our team and help us transform how Hong Kong’s workforce manages their retirement savings. This is a unique opportunity to be part of a fast-evolving industry and learn from the ground up in a dynamic, supportive environment. Ready to take the first step in your career with us? What You’ll Do: As an ePension Operation Executive, you’ll be at the forefront of the transition to the platform, helping individuals and employers manage their account. You’ll play an important role in ensuring that every step of the process runs smoothly, from registration and enrollment to payments and claims. The Key Responsibilities: Data Input and Accuracy - Accurately input transaction applications received. Ensure data entered into the system is correct and complete. Process Management and Document Verification - Understand and follow each process in the transaction cycle, including Registration, Enrollment, Data Modification, Contribution, Payment, Termination, Transfer, Investment, Claim, Document Management and Enquiries. - Check documents submitted to ensure they are complete and in compliance with the regulations. Compliance and Quality Assurance - Ensure strict adherence to regulations, internal guidelines, standard operating procedures (SOPs) and service level agreements (SLAs). - Collaborate with relevant team to resolve any discrepancies or issues. Client Communication and Clarification - Make outbound calls or send correspondence to clarify any missing or unclear information in submitted applications. - Provide clear explanations and guidance to clients on how to complete their application. Issue Investigation and Resolution - Investigate and analyze applications that have been rejected or failed validation. - Identify issues and work with relevant teams to resolve them in a timely and efficient manner. User Acceptance Testing (UAT) - Participate in User Acceptance Testing (UAT) to validate system functionality and stability. - Work closely with the development teams to identify defects and ensure proper follow-up. Inquiry Handling - Respond to inquiries regarding to transaction issues, application statuses, account balance and other related matters. - Investigate transaction issues and provide resolutions within the required SLAs. Document Management - Index and categorize documents to ensure correct and accurate account information is associated with each application. - Perform investigations if an account cannot be located or matched during document indexing. Payment Processing and Matching - Process payments and ensure they are properly matched with contributions within the required timelines. - Ensure all payment-related tasks comply with internal standards and regulatory requirements. We are looking for a team member with: - Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and document verification. - Willingness to adapt and learn in dynamic and transitional environment. - Strong organizational, time-management and problem-solving skills to handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines. - A proactive team player with the ability to work collaboratively. - Excellent command of spoken and written English and Mandarin/Cantonese to effectively communicate with Mandarin/Cantonese-speaking internal or external parties. - Willingness to work on Malaysia public holidays, following the Hong Kong public holiday schedule. - 5.5-day work week: Monday to Friday (full day) and Saturdays (half day). - 100% work in office. Able to work on shift arrangement. Perks and Benefits: • Employee Share Options / Performance Shares : The company introduced the Share Options / Performance Shares Plan to recognize employees' contributions and achievements in the growth of the company. • Investment : 0% sales charge for unit trust & 50% staff rebate on front end charges for stocks and ETFs * if you invest through our platform. • Snacks & Beverages : Enjoy a variety of snacks and drinks from vending machines, including fresh-brewed espresso, Americano, and more from the coffee machine. Additionally, we have a weekly Breakfast Day and Fruits Day ! • Relaxation : Access to a relaxation room equipped with massage chairs at all times to help you relieve tiredness and stress. • Yearly Activities : Participation in outdoor activities, celebrations during festive seasons, and more exciting events! • Remuneration Package : Competitive salary packages that are well above market rates for those with the right potential. • Annual Salary Review and Yearly Bonus : Both processes will be conducted depending on the company's performance and individual work performance. • Coverage : Comprehensive insurance along with Medical, Dental & Optical coverage. • Allowances : Monthly sports allowance, Enjoy yearly department gatherings, and welcome lunches for new staffs. • Training : Benefit from free external and internal training providers, ensuring continuous learning and development. • Annual Leave : Entitlement to 21 days of annual leave. These benefits are designed to enhance your overall well-being and ensure a rewarding working experience with us. Applicants are invited to email us a comprehensive resume with the following details via "Apply Now" button with: Qualifications Skills Working Experience Expected Salary All applications will be treated in strict confidence. We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified. Note: Job responsibilities / requirements are representative and are not intended to be a detailed list. Other tasks/abilities may be required of the incumbent, relative to the specific assignment.

Job Title: Manufacturing Operations Management System (MOM) IT System Support Specialist
Job Responsibilities: We are seeking a skilled and motivated MOM System Support & Specialist to manage, troubleshoot, and optimize the Manufacturing Operations Management (MOM) systems. This role will involve working closely with production teams, IT, and other departments to ensure the smooth operation of MOM software, improve manufacturing processes, and provide ongoing support and training to end-users. Duties include, but are not limited to the following: MOM System Implementation & Configuration: Support the implementation and configuration of MOM systems to meet business requirements. Participate in training to understand the architecture of the MOM system to support manufacturing processes, including production planning, inventory management, quality control, and more. Collaborate with other departments to understand process requirements and map them into the MOM system. System Maintenance & Optimization: Perform regular system maintenance, including software updates, patches, and backups. Monitor system performance to ensure optimal operation and identify any issues or bottlenecks. Troubleshoot and resolve any system issues or errors, ensuring minimal downtime. Analyze production data to recommend improvements in workflows and performance. User Support and Training: Provide user support for MOM system-related issues and inquiries. Train new and existing employees on the proper use of MOM software and its features. Develop user manuals and troubleshooting guides for employees. Collaboration with IT and Other Teams: Work closely with the IT department to ensure proper integration of the MOM system with other enterprise systems (ERP, PLM, QMS, etc.). Participate in cross-functional meetings to align MOM system goals with overall business objectives. Data Management & Reporting: Assist in the creation and management of production reports, KPIs, and performance metrics within the MOM system. Generate ad-hoc reports as needed to support decision-making. Ensure data integrity within the system by performing regular audits. Process Improvement: Continuously assess the manufacturing processes to identify opportunities for improvement through system enhancements. Work with the production team to streamline workflows and reduce inefficiencies. Documentation & Compliance: Maintain clear documentation of system configurations, troubleshooting steps, and processes. Ensure the MOM system complies with regulatory requirements and industry standards. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Manufacturing, or a related field (or equivalent work experience). 3-5 years of experience working with MOM, Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES), or similar systems in a manufacturing environment. Experience in system administration, support, and troubleshooting. Familiarity with ERP systems (SAP S4 Hana) and integration with MOM. Strong understanding of MOM software, data management, and system optimization. Experience with programming languages (SQL, Java, etc.) for system integration and reporting. Knowledge of production processes, manufacturing workflows, and related technologies. Experience with reporting tools and business intelligence software. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills. Excellent communication skills for training and support. Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills. Ability to work well in cross-functional teams and collaborate with various departments. Experience with specific MOM software platforms (e.g., Siemens Opcenter, Rockwell FactoryTalk, etc.). Certifications in relevant systems or technologies. Familiarity with lean manufacturing, Six Sigma, or other process improvement methodologies. Proficient in Mandarin will be an added advantage.

Summary We are seeking a qualified team leader to manage our team and provide effective guidance. This role involves managing the day-to-day operations of the team, providing guidance and support, and ensuring that project deadlines and quality standards are met. As the contact point for all team members, your communication skills should be excellent. You should also be able to act proactively to ensure smooth team operations and effective collaboration. The Annotator Team Leader will oversee a team of annotators, ensuring the quality and efficiency of data labeling processes, and be willing to wear multiple hats as a Trainer and Quality Lead. The ideal candidate will have strong leadership skills, a keen eye for detail, and experience in data annotation or a related field. Responsibilities: Lead and manage a team of annotators, including task assignment and performance monitoring. Oversee the quality of annotations and ensure adherence to project guidelines. Provide training to new team members and ongoing support to existing staff. Identify areas for improvement in the annotation process and implement changes as needed. Work closely with project managers and other stakeholders to ensure project requirements are met. Generate reports on team performance and project progress. Address any issues or challenges that arise within the team. Ensure the team is compliant and to be high on integrity regarding Data privacy. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in any discipline. 4-5 years experience in a team leader role, particularly in data annotation or a related field. Experience with specific annotation tools and platforms. Understanding of the domain relevant to the annotation project. Proven ability to lead and motivate a team. Strong attention to detail and commitment to quality. Familiarity with data annotation tools and software. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong organizational and time management skills. Decision making skills Ability to analyze problems and implement effective solutions. In-depth knowledge of performance metrics. Experience in managing a Team Ability to calibrate with the stakeholders and cascade the same to the team Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze data to identify trends and patterns.

Company Description Established in 1961, Malayan Flour Mills Berhad (MFM) is the pioneer in the flour milling industry in Malaysia. MFM has grown to become the leading flour miller in Malaysia with presence in Vietnam and Indonesia. Over the years, we have expanded into poultry integration, aquaculture, and raw material trading. In FY23, the group revenue was RM2.15 billion. With a workforce of 3,000, MFM has experienced significant growth both locally and regionally. Partnering with Tyson Food, Inc. and Toyota Tsusho Group, we aim to be a leading global halal food enterprise while pursuing sustainable development goals. Building the workforce of the future... today. We invite you to join our team! Job Description Responsible for analyzing data, operations and contract terms for commodity purchases. Identify market trends and correlations to recommend trading strategies and actions for risk management and inventory management of raw materials to meet the company’s strategic goals and objectives. To conduct data analysis on historical data (using VBA, Python, and other programming languages) to determine the seasonality trends and correlations of commodity prices using Refinitiv, Trading View, etc. To work closely with the Senior Purchasing Support Executive on operations and contract terms for commodity purchases. Responsible for enhancing back testing model and optimizing entry & exit strategy. Strategize procurement plans to optimize raw material costs, grain inventory, and financing costs. Importation stats and other data update. Manage inventory and planning for plants. Implement solutions regarding alternative grain types and grain origination. To compile weather, news, and market data daily to keep management and other departments updated with the latest market conditions. Work closely with stakeholders to conduct effective purchase planning for commodities. Ensure shipment arrival on time to meet production requirements. Plan effective storage for commodities. Work closely with international commodity suppliers. Perform price comparison and provide market updates. Prepare and present periodic reports. Recommend the next course of action based on analysis. To perform any other tasks and assignments as directed by the management from time to time. Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science, Engineering, or Actuarial Science Highly skilled in Excel VBA and Python programming language 3-5 years in commodity trade, procurement, shipment documentation and operations Additional Information Winner of HR Asia Best Company to Work For in Asia for 7 consecutive years in 2024, 2023, 2022, 2021, 2020, 2019 & 2018 Winner of HR Asia Most Caring Company Award for 6 consecutive years in 2024, 2023, 2022, 2021, 2020 & 2019 Winner of HR Asia Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Award for 2 consecutive years in 2024 & 2023 Winner of HR Asia Sustainable Workplace Award in 2024 Winner of HR Asia Happiest Workplace Award in 2024

Key Responsibilities: POS System Management: Install, configure, and maintain the outlet's POS system, ensuring it is functioning correctly and meeting business needs. Troubleshoot and resolve any technical issues with the POS system, promptly addressing any disruptions in service. Conduct routine system checks and updates to ensure optimal performance and security. Train new staff on the POS system, including order entry, payment processing, and other relevant functions. Data Analysis and Reporting: Extract and analyze data from the POS system to generate reports on sales, inventory, customer behavior, and employee performance. Identify trends and patterns in sales data to inform marketing and operational decisions. Prepare regular reports for management, highlighting key performance indicators and areas for improvement. Operational Optimization: Work with the outlet manager to identify opportunities to improve efficiency and reduce costs through the use of the POS system. Develop and implement processes to optimize the POS system workflow, ensuring a seamless customer experience. Collaborate with the franchisee's IT department on system upgrades and integrations, ensuring compatibility and smooth transitions. Customer Service: Provide prompt and courteous support to staff and customers regarding POS system issues. Assist in resolving customer complaints related to the POS system, ensuring a positive experience. Required Skills & Experience: Proven experience working with POS systems in a retail or restaurant environment. Strong understanding of POS system functionality, including order processing, inventory management, and reporting. Ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues. Proficiency in data analysis and report generation. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.

Our Data Scientists use their domain expertise to identify where AI can speed up operations, reduce costs, increase productivity, personalise the client experience; and build and deploy AI models. We’re looking for brilliant minds who are intellectually curious, analytical and willing to learn, with a numerate background in AI, mathematics, engineering, sciences or related disciplines. Our Data Scientists use their domain expertise to identify where Artificial Intelligence (AI) can speed up operations, reduce costs, increase productivity and personalise client experiences. We’re looking for brilliant minds who are intellectually curious, analytical and love to learn. About our Digital Channels & Data Analytics (DCDA) team They support our corporate clients, by creating a more equitable, sustainable, and prosperous future for clients and global communities through technology, data and digital. They’re responsible for being an expert in digital products and services and partner with our sales and coverage teams. About Corporate & Investment Banking (CIB) For more than 170 years we’ve support clients with their transaction banking, financial markets, corporate finance and borrowing needs and provide solutions to nearly 20,000 clients in the world’s fastest-growing economies and most active trade corridors. Key Responsibilities • Partner with stakeholders including our sales team, relationship managers, traders and leadership to understand where AI can optimise our business. • Define AI business requirements with tangible, measurable and commercial success criteria. • Mine large sets of data to uncover trends, insights, and opportunities from multiple internal and external data sources. • Enhance data collection methods through augmentation, normalisation, and outlier removal. • Recommend appropriate AI solutions and train AI models. • Deliver self-service dashboards to report on business use case and success criteria. • Use data visualisation for predicted outputs and insights and to translate complete analytics into business language. • Embed a framework of continuous monitoring to deployed models and solutions, for continuous enhancement. Skills and Experience • Experience and education in AI, Mathematics, Engineering, the Sciences, or related discipline. • Predictive models, machine learning algorithms and large language models. • Data visualisation tools, including Matplotlib, Plotly, Power BI and Tableau. • Natural Language Processing (NLP). • Python programming. • Financial mathematics. • Time series analysis. • Data governance and management. • AI regulatory compliance. • AI techniques including quantum machine We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 170 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents and we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us. Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion. Together we: Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well Are better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing. Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations. Time-off including annual leave, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 months maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum. Flexible working options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns. Proactive wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills, global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits A continuous learning culture to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning. Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation, one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.

Job Title: A&A - MY - Analyst - IT, Data & Analytics
Job Responsibilities: Are you ready to unleash your potential? At Deloitte, our purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and the communities we serve. We believe we have a responsibility to be a force for good, and WorldImpact is our portfolio of initiatives focused on making a tangible impact on society’s biggest challenges and creating a better future. We strive to advise clients on how to deliver purpose-led growth and embed more equitable, inclusive as well as sustainable business practices. Hence, we seek talented individuals driven to excel and innovate, working together to achieve our shared goals. We are committed to creating positive work experiences that foster a culture of respect and inclusion, where diverse perspectives are celebrated, and everyone is recognised for their contributions. Ready to unleash your potential with us? Join the winning team now! Work you’ll do Perform IT audit, regulatory compliance assessment and IT risk assessment, in areas covering IT general controls, application controls, business cycle and IT security review. Perform third party assurance engagement covering business and IT controls Understanding of COSO and IT Assurance Framework issued by ISACA. Able to evaluate IT internal controls and identify opportunities for controls improvement. Strong analytical and problem solving skills. He/she must have demonstrated knowledge of IT operations and experience executing audits. He/she must have Identify and evaluate complex technology and business risks and internal controls which mitigate risks, and related opportunities for internal control improvement. Your role as a leader At Deloitte, we believe in the importance of empowering our people to be leaders at all levels. We connect our purpose and shared values to identify issues as well as to make an impact that matters to our clients, people and the communities. Additionally, Analysts across our Firm are expected to: Demonstrate a strong commitment to personal learning and development. Understand how our daily work contributes to the priorities of the team and business. Understand the set expectations and demonstrate accountability in keeping personal performance on track. Actively focus on developing effective communications and relationship-building skills with stakeholders, clients and team. Demonstrate an appreciation for working with others. Understand what is fundamental to Deloitte’s success as a business. Demonstrate integrity and an awareness of strengths, differences, and personal impact. Develop their understanding of Deloitte and offer a fresh perspective. Requirements Degree in Information Systems, Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Studies, Actuarial Science or Cyber Risks or equivalent. Experience in IT audit, IT internal audit and/ or other related disciplines relevant to the role. Excellent written English and interpersonal skills, a team player and communicator, and a self-starter. Pro-actively identify other areas of business initiatives and changes in the business environment and assess their impact on the business control environment Able to handle multiple tasks and assignments Logical thinking, good and positive attitude, fast learner and good team player Able to work under pressure and meet deadlines Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Candidates will only be contacted by authorized Deloitte Recruiters via firm’s business contact number or business email address.

RESPONSIBILITIES: 1. Weighing Operations Management Operate and monitor weighbridge systems or other weighing equipment. Ensure accurate recording of incoming and outgoing goods' weight. Verify weight tickets, receipts, or invoices for accuracy. Compare and report any significant discrepancies in weight measurements. Calibrate weighing equipment regularly to ensure accuracy. Identify and report any malfunctions in weighing systems. 2. Data Entry & Documentation Maintain accurate records of weight data in company systems. Generate reports related to weight transactions. Ensure compliance with company policies and legal weight limits. Good receipt (GR) for incoming items. 3. Coordination & Communication Work closely with warehouse, logistics, or operation teams to ensure smooth operations. Communicate with drivers, suppliers, and customers regarding weight-related issues. Assist in resolving disputes related to weighing discrepancies. 4. General Administrative Support Handle invoices, permits, or other relevant documentation related to weighing operations. Support daily administrative tasks, including filing, scheduling, courier services and correspondence. Assist in stock or inventory control by providing weight-based data. Supply Chain Financial Analyst Description - Job Summary • This role is responsible for supporting financial management by analyzing, reporting, and reconciling financial and operational results, identifying and researching variances to plans, and providing recommendations to key stakeholders. The role engages in budgeting and forecasting processes while ensuring reporting compliance. The role supports priority projects and maintains strong relationships with internal stakeholders. Responsibilities • Performs data extraction as well as diagnosis of financial drivers, and leverages analytics to make recommendations to key stakeholders. • Conducts comprehensive financial analysis for specific functions or business units, addressing financial business issues and providing valuable analytics to support key business initiatives. • Provides inputs for monthly review of expenses and capital for budgeting and forecasting process and analyzes variances with operational analytics and insight. • Interprets financial reports, including forecasts, budgets, income statements, balance sheets and cash flow documents. • Acquires a comprehensive understanding of the organization's financial processes and gains proficient knowledge of the company's operations and business. • Supports business by closing the books, analyzing variances and trends, and developing financial forecasts that are consistent with the business objectives of the organization. • Ensures compliance with reporting standards and corporate policies and the integrity of external and internal reporting. • Applies foundational principles and contributes proactively to projects through research and data analysis support, providing regular updates on accomplishments and impediments. • Supports priority projects with direction, maintaining relationships with internal stakeholders and sharing information via standardized reports. Education & Experience Recommended • Four-year Degree in Business Administration, Economics, Finance, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence. • Typically has 0-2 years of work experience, preferably in financial management, internal audit, accounting, or a related field. Preferred Certifications • Certified Public Accountant (CPA) • Certified Financial Analyst (CFA) Knowledge & Skills • Accounting • Auditing • Automation • Corporate Finance • Data Analysis • Economics • Finance • Financial Analysis • Financial Modeling • Financial Planning • Financial Services • Financial Statements • Generally Accepted Accounting Principles • Internal Controls • Investments • Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) • Process Improvement • Profit And Loss (P&L) Management • SAP Applications • Variance Analysis Cross-Org Skills • Effective Communication • Results Orientation • Learning Agility • Digital Fluency • Customer Centricity Impact & Scope • Impacts own work and acts as a team member by providing information, analysis, and recommendations in support of team efforts. Complexity • Learns to apply basic theories and concepts to work tasks. Disclaimer • This job description describes the general nature and level of work performed in this role. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, skills, responsibilities, knowledge, etc. These may be subject to change and additional functions may be assigned as needed by management. #LI-POST Job - Finance Schedule - Full time Shift - No Shift premium (Malaysia) Travel - Relocation - Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO) - HP, Inc. provides equal employment opportunity to all employees and prospective employees, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, sexual orientation, age, disability, or status as a protected veteran, marital status, familial status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic predisposition or carrier status, uniformed service status, political affiliation or any other characteristic protected by applicable national, federal, state, and local law(s). Please be assured that you will not be subject to any adverse treatment if you choose to disclose the information requested. This information is provided voluntarily. The information obtained will be kept in strict confidence. Job Title: DRSC CRM Operation Support (Analyst/Consultant), AP Growth
Location: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, Kuala Lumpur
Job Responsibilities: Title: Asia Pacific CRM Support (based in Kuala Lumpur) – Analyst/Fresh Graduate Are you ready to unleash your potential? At Deloitte, our purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and the communities we serve. We believe we have a responsibility to be a force for good, and WorldImpact is our portfolio of initiatives focused on making a tangible impact on society’s biggest challenges and creating a better future. We strive to advise clients on how to deliver purpose-led growth and embed more equitable, inclusive as well as sustainable business practices. Hence, we seek talented individuals driven to excel and innovate, working together to achieve our shared goals. We are committed to creating positive work experiences that foster a culture of respect and inclusion, where diverse perspectives are celebrated, and everyone is recognised for their contributions. Ready to unleash your potential with us? Join the winning team now! Work you'll do Deloitte Asia Pacific brings together our geographies in Australia, China, Japan, Korea, South Asia, Southeast Asia, New Zealand and Taiwan with more than 4,000 partners and 90,000 professionals. The formation of the Deloitte Asia Pacific Member Firm enhances our ability to provide a more seamless client experience across geographical boundaries, while at the same time offering you unique and unrivalled career experiences and opportunities. The AP Growth organization within Deloitte Asia Pacific is responsible for driving growth and alignment in sales processes across the Deloitte network in the region in order to deliver a consistent experience and the very best of Deloitte to our priority clients and strategic sectors in the region. Our goal is to serve our clients and sectors with quality and distinction and make a measurable, tangible, and attributable impact. An exciting opportunity to join as CRM Operation Support in our CRM Enablement Team which oversees Jupiter, our internal Global CRM platform (Salesforce). The CRM Enablement team covers three core pillars Adoption, Functionality, and User Support responsible for maximizing value for our front office teams and providing a consistent experience for our clients. Jupiter represents a major step forward in Deloitte’s digital transformation journey enabling us to manage, retain, and grow our client relationships, regardless of where our clients or we are in the world. Jupiter is established in over 60 countries making it one of the largest global Salesforce deployments. Job highlights: Support & Collaboration Be the go-to contact for CRM user inquiries through AP Support and ServiceNow, ensuring quick and efficient resolution. Collaborate with Global teams and Local Admins to resolve issues seamlessly. Data Management & Optimization Lead efforts to maintain CRM data accuracy, manage accounts and opportunity data, and identify/report process gaps to drive improvements and efficiency. Internal Communication Create and share a monthly newsletter and ad-hoc updates to keep the team informed. Maintain and update internal communication channels like the Teams site and intranet. Responsibilities Participate in and drive Deloitte’s digital transformation by increasing user adoption, capturing accurate data, and delivering meaningful insights. Provide Client & Sales insights for key stakeholders across business units in Asia Pacific. Promote analytics-driven decision making and transform CRM data into actionable insights. Support CRM operations around sales management, reporting, and marketing. Manage CRM data quality and ensure data quality and data accuracy. Develop reports/dashboards using Salesforce/PowerBI. Advise on best practices in application set-up, workflow, and customizations. Identify reporting issues, gaps in processes, and drive timely resolutions. Ad-hoc CRM related matters and areas you would like to drive improvement. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in any field demonstrating rigorous thinking and ability to articulate complex ideas such as Engineering, Programming, Literature, Data Analysis, etc., is preferred. Fresh graduates or individuals with 1 year of experience are encouraged to apply. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must. Strong preference for working knowledge of CRM or ERP systems and experience with business processes, analytics, data, predictive modeling, or business intelligence. Attention to detail, analytical and logical problem-solving skills, and the ability to think critically are essential. Proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint, along with a passion for working with data to identify trends and make recommendations, are highly valued. Familiarity with concepts like Macro/SQL/HTML/Python is advantageous. Ability to effectively engage with busy leaders and professionals. Fluency in English is required, and proficiency in another Asian language is a plus. Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Candidates will only be contacted by authorised Deloitte Recruiters via firm’s business contact number or business email address.

Company Description Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realize their financial goals and help them save time and money. We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments. We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com. Job Description Job description The Reporting Analyst position is essential to the continuous evolution of our financial reporting processes. With a focus on digital transformation for finance, the primary objective of this role is to support a variety of critical activities within the Digital Insights operations, ensuring support for our internal finance stakeholders. This role is pivotal in designing, building, testing, and implementing finance reports within the CXO-Cockpit application, while also establishing robust governance and maintenance processes to support our finance community effectively. Brief About our team The Global Finance Digital Insights team, comprising over 30 talented professionals, serves Experian's finance teams across the globe, including locations in Nottingham (UK), Sofia (Bulgaria), Kuala Lumpur (Malaysia), Costa Mesa & Texas (USA), Bogota (Colombia), and Sao Paulo (Brazil). Our team of finance and IT specialists collaborates to manage Experian's financial reporting systems, ensuring integrity, accuracy, and consistency. We are also at the forefront of defining and deploying new reporting applications and management information tools. What you'll be doing Report design Build relationships with the finance community to collaborate and determine new report requirements. Develop reports in CXO-Cockpit to meet these requirements. Provide best practice report design advice, troubleshoot & improve existing report design Content reviews Conduct cyclical reviews of all application content to improve and align reports. Collaborate with the software provider to assess new features and request system improvements Identify gaps in report templates and implement improvements. Expand use-cases for current reports to promote global adoption. Application management Perform report and application maintenance activities. Lead system management of reporting cycles (Budget, QPRs, HYR). Develop governance and control processes. Monitor report performance, use best-in-practice scripting skills to improve speed Provide coaching for team members. Process Improvement Enhance internal team processes. Manage support tickets in the ServiceNow queue during APAC hours, ensuring resolution. Manage external and internal documents, including access and security instructions and developer process notes. User support Develop finance user training documentation. Manage end-user provisioning and access. Qualifications Qualifications Education: Degree preferrable in finance or IT technical courses. Experience minimum 3+ years proven experience in reporting and data analytics, within a finance function Effective Communicator: Confident speaker with excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. Data Visualization: Strong knowledge of data visualization techniques. Technical Expertise: Familiarity with finance reporting applications such as Tableau, Power BI, CXO-Cockpit, Hyperion, OBIEE, Business Objects, etc. Advanced Skills: expertise in Excel (advanced) and PowerPoint. Additional Knowledge: Awareness of SQL/MDX language is a plus. Additional Information Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Experian's culture and people are important differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously and focus on what matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, collaboration, wellness, reward & recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. Experian's people first approach is award-winning; World's Best WorkplacesTM 2024 (Fortune Top 25), Great Place To WorkTM in 24 countries, and Glassdoor Best Places to Work 2024 to name a few. Check out Experian Life on social or our Careers Site to understand why. Experian is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Innovation is an important part of Experian's DNA and practices, and our diverse workforce drives our success. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity. Job Title: Banking Operations – Analyst, MSME (Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprise)
Job Responsibilities: Responsibilities Be our Analyst in our Business Banking Operations - Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSME) Collaborate with product, customer experience and business to create a robust operation process that delight our customers where it matters most. Use advanced data analytics to explore operations issues/opportunities, uncover insights and/or identify targeted areas for efficiency improvement and risk mitigation. Ensure day-to-day operations comply with the regulatory and internal requirements. Leverage technology to drive a high degree of digitalisation and scalability. Analyse potential pitfalls across the process cycle for product launches and system roll out, which may impact operations effectiveness. Drive higher degree of effectiveness of control measures. Use big data analysis to discover patterns and potential hot spots Process deposit and loan application, closely follow up on customer submissions until opening of business account or disbursement of the loans are completed. Process all internal operations related to MSME banking on our digital platform transaction processing, and ad-hoc handling. To achieve satisfactory completion rate of all assigned tasks on MSME products The must haves: Process Management - Ability to streamline processes and workflows for MSME banking operations, leveraging digital journey coupled with manual handling techniques to ensure efficiency and accuracy. Issue Resolution - Act as a point of escalation for complex customer edge-cases, complaints, and operational issues, providing timely and effective resolution to maintain high levels of outcome Collaboration -Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product development, business, and customer service, to align MSME banking operations with overall business objectives and strategy. Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or related field. Minimum of 2 years of experience in banking operations, with a focus on MSME segment. Strong understanding of MSME banking processes and procedures, with experience in manual handling within a digital banking environment. Possess prior experience and exposure in processing of business loan applications, will be an added advantage & preferred. Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Good communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders. Knowledge of regulatory requirements and compliance standards governing MSME banking operations. Credit Analyst and Risk Management background will be a plus point for this role.

At Miifix Digital Sdn Bhd, we are more than just a mobile device repair company—we are innovators, problem-solvers, and industry leaders. Established in 2009, we have consistently set the standard for quality and service in the mobile repair industry. Our commitment to excellence has earned us the trust of customers and partners across Malaysia. Our services extend beyond retail; we collaborate closely with insurance companies, educational programs, and trade clients, providing comprehensive solutions that meet diverse needs. Additionally, we are at the forefront of the trade-in sector, continually evolving to offer cutting-edge solutions through strategic partnerships and technology. At Miifix Digital, we believe in pushing boundaries and creating value, not just for our clients, but for the industry as a whole. Join us, and be a part of a dynamic team that's shaping the future of mobile device solutions in Malaysia. Responsibilities: Enter and update inventory data into the company’s inventory management system Ensure that inventory is properly organized and stored in the warehouse according to predefined systems, such as FIFO (First In, First Out) or LIFO (Last In, First Out), based on product type. Oversee the transfer of stock between locations, branches, or warehouses, ensuring that inventory is correctly recorded and accounted for. Regularly perform stock reconciliations and audits to verify that the physical inventory aligns with the system records. Ensure that all inventory transactions (e.g., shipments, returns, stock transfers) are properly documented and entered into the inventory management system. Tasks & responsibilities Oversee all aspects of buyback & trade-in projects, including program deployment at retail stores, daily trade-in operations, promoter management, planning and implementing promotional campaigns, and conducting monthly performance reviews with improvement plans. Collaborate with partners across various industries (OEMs, Telcos, Distributors) within Malaysia to enhance program effectiveness. Coordinate with the team to manage and improve our trade-in mobile app, ensuring cutting-edge trade-in solutions are provided to our diverse partners. Serve as the liaison and primary point of contact between internal business units and external business partners, acting as a project manager to evaluate, prioritize, develop, and deploy device buyback programs at partner retail stores. Contribute to the development and execution of strategic and tactical business plans alongside other members of the cross-functional team supporting the trade in strategy. Company Name: Emerson Process Management Manufacturing (M) Sdn Bhd
Job Responsibilities: Job Summary: If you are an Engineering professional and looking to expand your career to a lead role, Emerson has a great job opportunity for you! This position has overall management responsibility of Electronics Manufacturing Services (EMS) to ensure smooth production efficiency and meeting customer requirements in terms of output, delivery and quality. If you think this role is suitable for you, let's go and join our team! In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be: Data collection, reports generation and coordination of activities with EMS to maintain smooth relationship and operation efficiency Track cost reduction activities and targets for each of the EMS sites Report on key performance measures, takes appropriate actions and work to resolve when performance dips below established targets Implement supply chain strategies to exceed business objectives relating to cost, quality and delivery metrics Participate in discussion on business reviews, measuring key performance metrics and drives for continuous improvement Support timely execution on NPIs through coordination with appropriate functions ensuring all business, commercial and technology requirements are adhered Review DDSS/Supply plan weekly as published by EMS and identifies/track component parts that may require premium purchase after ensuring all avenues has been exhausted Validate that component parts requiring premium purchase raised by EMS corresponds to shortages as reflected in the supply plan Ensure the premium price proposed is in tandem with what the open market is offering Monitor inventory dollar value at key EMS sites for both Turnkey and Consignment and challenges EMS if inventory received is excess to demand per lead time Based on inventory monitoring records, approves for month end carrying charges and quarterly turnkey to consignment proposal Ensure that inventory is depleted on a FIFO basis, paying particular attention that consign inventory is being depleted before EMS takes new orders in Work closely with the pricing lead and push back EMS on price increases when the re-pricing activity has just been completed Ensure not to exceed the PPV budget allocated for the year and all key indicators are up to date and reported on time Other duties as assigned or as the business requires Who You Are: You follow through on commitments and make sure others do the same. You act with a clear sense of ownership, take personal responsibility for decisions, actions, and failures, establish clear responsibilities and processes for supervising work and measuring results. You design feedback loops into work. You are effective in a variety of communication settings: one-on-one, small and large groups, or among diverse styles and position levels. Attentively listen to others, adjust to fit the audience and the message and provide timely and helpful information to others across the organization. You work cooperatively with others to achieve shared objectives, represent own interests while being fair to others and their areas as well as partner with others to get work done. For This Role, You Will Need: Good working knowledge of Electronics Manufacturing and Supporting Processes General knowledge of key distributors and brokers in the region to assist with sourcing activities Proficiency with ERP systems (SAP/Oracle, etc.) and Microsoft office Able to handle and process large amount of data accurately Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a good command of both verbal and written English Integrity and courage in highlighting issues and concerns Reviewing proposals and being able to articulate better solutions Self-motivated and able to work with minimal direction Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart: Relevant degree holder with minimum 3 years working experience in similar role in an electronic or contract electronics manufacturing environment Experience with MS Teams/ SharePoint and Data Repository systems Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills Ability to adapt to change Occasional travel may be required Our Offer To You: By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do. Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets. We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees. We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion. We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential. We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company. We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office. Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities. Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent.

Job Title: Senior Staff Engineer, IT Production Data Engineering Technical Expert

Get to Know the Team Grab enables Advertisers, Organisations, Agencies, and Merchants to engage the Grab Ecosystem and Grab Audience via innovative offerings. Through our unique ecosystem and transacting user base, our clients are able to reach their desired audiences at scale, while driving measurable business outcomes. We would like you to join our journey to create value for our users, drivers, merchants, and advertising partners while continuing to make everyday lives better across Southeast Asia. Get to Know the Role You will collaborate with Sales Operations, Commercial, Product Analytics, and Finance teams to create strategies, processes, and targets that support Grab's Sales teams. By combining strategic and operational expertise, you'll contribute to sales strategy, customer segmentation, company structure, process improvement, and business analytics. Reporting to the Regional Sales Operations Manager, Sales Ops & Analytics, you'll be based onsite in Petaling Jaya. The Critical Tasks You Will Perform Sales Steering & Performance You will be a key business partner to the Commercial Country Head managing MY & SG and the Country Sales Managers. You will lead the end-to-end execution of Country Market Planning / Business Reviews. You will drive data into monitoring and analyzing key sales and business performance indicators and trends to drive strategic and tactical business decisions, while also coordinating and ensuring the accuracy of sales forecasts. You will support Country Sales Heads and the Sales Team to monitor and forecast revenue performance and other sales KPIs against Quarterly Sales Targets. You will be a tactical to strategic planner, supporting the Sales Team with sales and market data intelligence analysis for business cases using internal and external data. You will partner with Country Sales leadership to define and execute sales strategy, sales policies, processes, and business system requirements. Process Excellence You will maintain the integrity of sales and customer data by driving adoption and proper usage of sales tools, including SalesForce.com. You will enable access to sales data and KPIs via tools like SalesForce.com, Google Sheets, PowerBI, etc. You will enforce pricing and discount policies. You will work with Regional Operations Teams to roll out new solutions to improve the efficiency of Sales Operations processes in the Country.

It also serves as a "new infrastructure" for expanding ecological boundaries. Together we can build an innovative, secure, and intuitive live traffic and ecosystem team for our users. The Customer Service Excellence team provides world-class service and experience for customers and creators. We are looking for an exceptional Workforce Management (WFM) Real Time Analyst (RTA), who is passionate about their work, understands how to manage calls across a network of contact centers and in-house customer service teams, having the ability to contribute new innovations to the Tiktok Live PTE Workforce Management Team. The ideal candidate will possess experience in typical workforce management disciplines: Scheduling, Real Time Monitoring, proficient reporting skills, and experience optimizing manpower in customer service environments. The ideal candidate would also support and own proactive tactical workforce management responses to address service level challenges. In this role you will experience a wide range of problem-solving situations that require immediate real time intervention, as well as short term scheduling management and planning. Roles & Responsibilities Monitors queue performance, provide intra-day updates on contact volume and capacity. Takes actions to resolve or reduce service level impacting issues. Provides clear, concise notification to Operations and Support teams as required. Compares staffing to forecast requirements. Takes corrective actions as required examples include: Cross language support, non-productive time cancellation, and OT. Metric reviews including shrinkage, scheduled adherence and contacts handled analysis to improve service levels. Leverages appropriate operational tools and applications to deep dive Demand (Volume/AHT) and Staffing impacts. Utilize data to identify root cause and recommend resolving actions. Coordinate with outsourced service providers, to ensure staffing performance is meeting or exceeding acceptable standards. Adjust routing schemes and realign resources to optimize coverage and service based on skill set and priority, across multiple sites. Recognizes and initiates escalation processes for routing issues or any other incident and initiates appropriate tactics to ensure service levels are maintained. Provide feedback, analysis and reporting of relevant trends, such as: ticket performance stats, ticket/task arrival patterns, staff productivity, attrition rates and resource allocation. Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent 3+ years of program or project management experience Experience in a highly analytical, results-oriented environment with cross functional interactions Knowledge of SQL/Excel at an intermediate level Ability to work on shift work basis Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in BI, finance, engineering, statistics, computer science, mathematics, finance or equivalent quantitative field 3+ years' experience in WFM Real-time Service Level management Experience in coordinating with outsourced service providers Experience in requirement gathering and ability to write clear and detailed requirement document TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Company Description We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to deliver ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high-value work they live for. Do you love getting to the root cause of customer business processing issues and finding ways to avoid them from happening again? At Unit4 Cloud Ops, we're looking for analytical, logical talents like you to join our team and help us build better solutions for our customers. With a structured approach, tools and processes, and the latest analytical and troubleshooting skills, you'll be equipped to solve problems quickly and effectively. You'll also have the opportunity to learn hot skills in the market such as Azure, DevOps, and troubleshooting - ranging from infrastructure, virtualization, operating systems, and the application stack. Joining Unit4 Cloud Ops means you'll have access to all the resources you need to thrive and develop as a Cloud Ops professional. Our team of experts will mentor and guide you to become the best you can be. Working arrangement: work from anywhere in Malaysia Qualifications Here are the qualities and qualifications we're looking for: Experience in Windows OS, Active Directory, SQL server, Powershell, SMTP, IIS, FTP/SMTP Willingness to learn: We're always striving to improve and innovate, and we're looking for team members who share that mindset. We want individuals who are eager to learn new technologies and practices, and who are excited to grow their skills. Resourcefulness: As a Cloud Ops professional, you'll need to be able to search for information and apply solutions quickly and efficiently. We're looking for individuals who can think critically and creatively to find the best solutions. Technical skills: We require good knowledge of MS Windows Server monitoring and maintenance, as well as experience with automation and scripting tools such as PowerShell, JSON, or other scripting languages. Knowledge of network infrastructure, Microsoft Azure platform, and SQL Server is an advantage. Communication skills: Good communication skills in English, both verbal and written, are essential. We value team members who can collaborate effectively and clearly communicate technical information. Additional Information Join Unit4 and you’ll be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud software space today. We’re a fast-paced and high-growth people-centric cloud player offering a host of benefits & development opportunities for individuals serious about their careers: Work, learn & be inspired by some of the best talents in the software space Talent program for high performers. Each year we provide a platform for high-potential talent to accelerate their careers! Committed to corporate social responsibility with our Act4Good initiative, our global movement to do good, and a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society Diversity4U. Helping our people thrive starts with a safe and inclusive work environment. We launched our Diversity4U program that builds on our “be genuine” value Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity to grow your skills and build a successful career at U4 Cloud Ops. Apply now and take the first step towards becoming a great Cloud Ops professional! This role may require security clearance required for customer projects and access to sensitive (customer) data. That means that after you have accepted our offer, we could ask for background checks. Subject to applicable local laws, such security checks may require disclosure of personal information including criminal record declaration, right to work, personal identification and work history. No worries though – we'll handle it according to local privacy laws and keep your info safe. Questions? Feel free to reach out!

About the Company Our client is a leading treasury management infrastructure provider, offering innovative solutions to financial institutions and large corporate enterprises. They provide various solutions, including an Automated Multi-Channel Reconciliation Solution, Multi-Bank Connector Solution, FX Conversion for corporations and Financial Institutions, and Cross-Border Payment Rails. Our client is a licensed treasury management and cross-border trade solutions provider across Africa. Founded in 2017, they envision being Africa's trusted trade infrastructure, unlocking potential and driving prosperity. Headquartered in London, with operational bases in Canada and Nigeria, they provide financial institutions with innovative trade and payment solutions. Description Our client seeks a Sales Operations Analyst/Associate to optimize the sales process, drive pipeline efficiency, and support revenue growth. The ideal candidate will be an expert in HubSpot CRM and leverage data analytics to ensure accurate sales forecasting, CRM hygiene, and overall sales cycle efficiency. This role is integral to streamlining sales operations and enabling sales teams to perform at their highest potential. This position can be based in India or Asia and offers the opportunity to work with a dynamic, high-growth team. Application Process & Qualifying Questions Candidates are required to read the full JD and submit answers to the following qualifying questions along with their CV, required compensation and notice period/availability. Applications without responses to these questions will not be considered: Can you provide evidence of strong experience in setting up and managing HubSpot CRM? What experience do you have in data analysis and supporting B2B sales teams? How have you improved sales pipeline forecasting accuracy in a previous role? What tools or methods did you use? Can you provide an example of when you optimized a sales process or workflow using HubSpot or another CRM? What impact did it have on efficiency or revenue? Responsibilities CRM Management & Sales Process Optimization Own the administration, maintenance, and continuous optimization of HubSpot CRM. Develop and enforce CRM hygiene best practices, ensuring clean, accurate, and up-to-date data. Implement automation tools and workflows within HubSpot to enhance sales productivity. Sales Pipeline & Forecasting Maintain an accurate and reliable sales pipeline, ensuring seamless tracking of deal stages. Develop and refine pipeline forecasting models to enable data-driven decision-making. Provide insights into win/loss analysis, helping to identify bottlenecks and opportunities. Data & Analytics Analyse sales performance metrics and provide actionable insights to improve efficiency. Generate dashboards and reports to track KPIs, including conversion rates and deal velocity. Identify trends and recommend strategies to optimize sales performance. Cross-Functional Collaboration Work closely with sales leadership to improve sales effectiveness and process efficiency. Collaborate with marketing teams to align lead generation strategies with sales objectives. Support finance and operations teams by ensuring accurate revenue tracking and reporting. Training & Enablement Provide training and support to sales teams on HubSpot CRM best practices. Develop training materials and documentation for CRM usage and process adherence. Requirements Minimum of 5 years of experience in sales, business development, and/or partnership roles. Excellent command of the English language Expert-level experience with HubSpot CRM and a deep understanding of sales automation tools. Strong data analysis skills with proficiency in Excel, Google Sheets, or BI tools. Proven experience in B2B sales support, sales operations, or revenue operations. Ability to interpret and visualize data to inform sales strategies and decision-making. Detail-oriented, process-driven, and highly organized with a focus on operational efficiency. Strong communication skills with the ability to collaborate across teams and geographies. Experience working in a high-growth fintech, payments, or SaaS environments is a plus. On Offer Competitive compensation package (Base Salary + Bonus). Flexible/remote working. Opportunity to work with talented professionals in a dynamic and growing industry. Role autonomy and opportunities for professional growth and development. Playing a key role in the leadership and future direction of the organisation.

Job Responsibilities: Responsibilities TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo. Why Join Us Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imagination thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impacts on ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. Join us. About Trust & Safety Building a world where people can safely discover, create and connect. The Trust & Safety (T&S) team at TikTok helps ensure that our global online community is safe and empowered to create and enjoy content across all of our applications. We have invested heavily in human and machine-based moderation to remove harmful content quickly and often before it reaches our general community. About the Team The Search Operations team aims to improve search user experience, contribute significant DAU impact to the products and drive for increase in traffic and GMV. The Global E-commerce Ops Team is responsible for capturing and identifying users' commerce intentions and operating the whole process to promote GMV. This team focuses on building and strengthening user awareness that they can shop on TikTok, enhance the usage frequency of the search function, and stimulate users' e-commerce search needs, while improving users' search experience, accelerating the e-commerce business to grow. It is possible that this role will be exposed to harmful content as part of the core role/as part of project/ in response to escalation requests/by chance. This may occur in the form of images, video, and text related to every-day life, but it can also include (but is not limited to) bullying; hate speech; child safety; depictions of harm to self and others, and harm to animals. Responsibilities: Operation & Data Management Complete daily operational tasks including quality inspection, policy and process optimization, queue assignment and handling escalations of the labelling project. Work closely with respective project stakeholders and vendors to stay up to date with policy developments and provide feedback on implementation and execution. Performing daily audits on internal systems, monitoring specialist's quality scores and providing analysis of errors and feedback to respective teams (R&D & Product Manager). Monitoring project data, recording daily output and quality scores, preparing data analysis/report of projects as well as validating reports and data provided to stakeholders/partners. Judging user search needs through various queries and tools, and sorting out the classification of requirements. Analyze the difference between search-type results such as goods, videos, hashtags, or users and rate the quality of these results based on policies. While it is assumed the evaluator will focus on their area of expertise, there will be occasions in which he/she will work on projects outside this core area that could require other capabilities, such as using assessment methods flexibly to support related projects. Training Management Localizing the policy guidelines designing training schedules, coordinating and liaise with key stakeholders to ensure that all specialists successfully go-live within the targeted timeframe. Deliver process/product/policy training in classroom and/or virtually to new joiners. Involve in setting up product knowledge tests, sharing result analysis and working with key stakeholders to improve the product knowledge of the team. Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: Diploma/Degree in any related field. At least 1 year of exposure to search engine optimization, search labelling or any other search related business experience. Proficient English, both written and conversational. Preferred Qualifications: Familiarity with search engines and algorithms of any social media platform would be a plus point. An in-depth understanding of the culture and familiarity with the internet usage habits of their users. Comfortable with and understanding that the job requires reviewing internet content that may be deemed inappropriate and / or contain explicit materials. Strong understanding of e-commerce platforms, customer journeys and localization challenges. Excellent identifying problems, problem-solving skills, and learning abilities. Trust & Safety recognises that keeping our platform safe for TikTok communities is no ordinary job which can be both rewarding and psychologically demanding and emotionally taxing for some. This is why we are sharing the potential hazards, risks and implications in this unique line of work from the start, so our candidates are well informed before joining. We are committed to the wellbeing of all our employees and promise to provide comprehensive and evidence-based programs, to promote and support physical and mental wellbeing throughout each employee's journey with us. We believe that wellbeing is a relationship and that everyone has a part to play, so we work in collaboration and consultation with our employees and across our functions in order to ensure a truly person-centred, innovative and integrated approach. TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Job Description for the position: Configure, monitor, upgrade and maintain MySQL databases in all environments. Proactive improve the efficiency of daily routine task as well as effectiveness when it comes to database performance tuning, data migration and recovery specifications. Familiar with Linux Operating System, as well as scripting languages such as Bash Shell and familiar with Go programming will be an added advantage. Preferably candidates with strong problem solving skill, good analytical thinker and organization skills. Able to work in a high database transaction processing environment. Able to communicate in English and Mandarin.

Job Description: Responsibility To support in building a resilient supply chain and responsible sourcing by mapping all raw materials to mils and to plantations, The work shall help in building supply chain insights, developing landscape programmes on forest and peat restoration, fair labour, net zero and smallholders' inclusion. To process and to collate global supply data, monitor supply of raw materials for all downstream refineries and develop the quarterly internal Traceability Declaration Documents. To maintain up to date traceability datasets of oil palm plantations, mills and Business Units for SDG operations globally. To analyse supply chain data with Geographic Information System (GIS) to verify deforestation allegations, combine external datasets, and communicate progress on sourcing footprints. To assess suppliers’ sustainable sourcing performance using publicly available information and NDPE Implementation Reporting Framework (NDPE-IRF). To disclose progress on traceability, sustainable sourcing performance and initiatives publicly and to respond to customers; queries/questionnaires. To assist in developing carbon footprint accounting and reporting. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in science, business, finance/accounting, engineering or data/information technology. Experience in Sustainability related work is an added advantage. Knowledge in Supply Chain Traceability and Sustainability related field, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint, Power BI, mapping and spatial analysis using QGIS. To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter outlining your interest for this role.

You will be a member of the Infra Operation & Cyber Security team reporting to the IT Server Ops Team Lead. Duties and Responsibilities: • Manage and perform administrative tasks on databases (Microsoft SQL, Oracle, MySQL) running on Windows & Linux platforms. • Monitoring the health of the databases, and perform trouble-shooting to identify and resolve any reported issues. • Install, configure and setup databases for application use. • Perform upgrade of databases and/or migration of databases from one product to another. • Perform database refresh across different environments. • Perform tuning and optimization activities to improve database performance and utilization of storage space. • Involve in the hardening of cloud databases like Azure SQL. • Monitor and manage data replication, including execution of database switchover for Disaster Recovery (DR) exercises. • Perform database maintenance, including applying and validating of security & critical patches. • Manage database security, and engage in process improvement such as automation of tasks and procedures. • Execute and provide technical support for the deployment of application fixes and/or changes in relation to the database. • Participate in system audits, adhere to the internal security standards. • Manage and co-ordinate with 3rd party vendors to troubleshoot and resolve problems. • Ensure availability and continuity of database services. • Involve in incident, problem, change and service request management. Requirements: • Diploma / Degree in Information Technology or equivalent with at least 5 years of experience in infrastructure support. • Minimum 5 years’ experience of MS SQL/MYSQL and Oracle DB Server. • Experience and understand with Azure Cloud, AAD, IAAS, PAAS, SAAS and etc. • Proficient in Database installation, configuration on Linux / Windows/Azure platforms. • Experience in Database High Availability setup using Oracle Dataguard, SQL Server Failover Replication/Mirroring Availability Groups, MySQL Cluster • Good database performance tuning, troubleshooting skills and locating bottlenecks at both server and database level. • Familiar with database partitioning design, Data warehouse, TDE encryption and implementing security standards to secure critical environments. • Disaster Recovery implementations based on Oracle Dataguard./SQL server /MYSQL Work with infrastructure team on upgrades, patching and resolution of cross functional issues. • Knowledge on SAP,CCNB,CRM,Oracle JDBC, ODP.Net, UCP, TAF, FCF, and MySQL Connectors. • Provide deployment support for database objects in production and UAT environments. • Provide 24x7 production database support and willing to work after office hours / weekends. Experienced with standard database monitoring tools. • Experience in Linux and Windows Shell scripting and PL/SQL Programming Required Skills: • Strong troubleshooting skills • Strong documentation and organizational skills • Independent worker with minimum supervision • Good team player and process driven • Good verbal and written communication skills
