Key Responsibilities: Inventory Management: Oversee the day-to-day operations of the inventory system. Ensure proper stock rotation and management to avoid overstocking or stockouts. Monitor and manage inventory levels across multiple locations or warehouses. Conduct regular stock audits and resolve discrepancies. Stock Replenishment & Ordering: Coordinate with procurement teams to reorder stock based on consumption patterns and inventory analysis. Track order fulfillment and ensure stock availability in line with production or sales requirements. Data Analysis & Reporting: Analyze inventory trends and create reports for senior management regarding stock levels, product movement, and potential issues. Develop inventory control reports to forecast future stock requirements. Work with data to optimize order cycles and inventory turnover rates. Supplier & Vendor Relations: Maintain good relationships with suppliers to ensure timely and accurate deliveries. Communicate with vendors regarding stock shortages or quality issues. Process Improvement: Identify areas for process improvements in inventory management. Implement best practices to optimize inventory control, reduce wastage, and improve stock accuracy. Team Coordination & Leadership: Supervise inventory clerks or other junior staff, providing training and mentorship. Coordinate with other departments, including finance, production, and logistics, to ensure seamless inventory management. Ensure compliance with company policies, safety regulations, and quality standards. Inventory Software Management: Maintain and update inventory management software to ensure data accuracy. Use advanced software tools for tracking and forecasting inventory needs. Problem Resolution: Address inventory discrepancies or issues promptly and effectively. Resolve problems related to damaged, lost, or expired stock. Compliance & Audit: Ensure compliance with relevant industry regulations and internal policies. Prepare for and assist with audits related to inventory processes. Qualifications: Education: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Logistics, or a related field. Experience: Minimum of 2 years of experience in inventory management, logistics, or a related field. Skills: Strong knowledge of inventory management software (e.g., SAP, Oracle, or other ERP systems). Analytical skills to interpret data and trends. Strong organizational and time management skills. Attention to detail and problem-solving abilities. Excellent communication and leadership skills.

Reporting: Create and maintain dashboards and reports that visualize key performance indicators (KPIs) for Fulfillment Operations. Collaboration: Work closely with Fulfillment Operations Leaders to understand data needs and uncover challenges within the platform. Support Decision-Making: Assist in data-driven decision-making processes by providing actionable insights derived from analysis. Excellent written and verbal communication skills for presenting findings clearly. Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team environment.

Job Title: Freight Forwarding Operations Executive & Account Cum Admin
Job Responsibilities: Job Description: We are seeking dynamic and motivated individuals to join our team in the roles of Cargo Operations Executive and Account Cum Admin (2 position) Why Join Us: Competitive Compensation: We offer salaries that are higher than the market rate, recognizing and rewarding your valuable contributions. Flexible Work Arrangements: Enjoy a balanced work-life harmony with our flexible work schedule: Weekdays: Monday to Friday, 8:30 AM - 5:30 PM (in-office) Weekends: Saturday, 8:00 AM - 12:00 PM (work from home) Cargo Operations Executive: Responsibilities: Handle day-to-day operations and oversee documentation and operational workflow. Coordinate import and export shipping matters according to customers’ requirements. Collaborate with overseas agents, carriers, co-loaders, and vendors to ensure timely receipt and delivery of shipments. Manage shipping documentation formalities (Port Authority, Customs, Tradenet, Portnet). Arrange bookings with carriers/co-loaders and execute all pertinent shipping documentation (e.g., Custom Permits, Shipping Order, Delivery Instructions). Ensure proper and timely billing and closure of jobs. Requirements: Diploma or Degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or related field. Minimum 2 years of experience in freight forwarding. Strong knowledge of import and export procedures, customs regulations, and international trade. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Proficient in MS Office, especially Excel. Ability to start at short notice is advantageous. Account Cum Admin: Responsibilities: Handle accounts payable and receivable. Prepare and process invoices, payments, and expense claims. Maintain accurate financial records. Assist with general administrative tasks, such as filing, photocopying, and data entry. Provide administrative support to the sales and operations teams. Requirements: Diploma or equivalent qualification in Accounting, Finance, or related field. Minimum 1 year of experience in accounting or administrative roles. Strong organizational and time management skills. Attention to detail and accuracy. Proficient in MS Office, especially Excel.

Summary: Incumbents apply in-depth knowledge in a specific area of specialization. Work is performed within established professional standards and practices. Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of identifiable factors and a considerable degree of judgement. Erroneous decisions or failure to achieve results may have a negative impact on the division’s/department’s operations, schedules, and/or performance goals. Works under minimum Supervision. Seeks approval from others on matters outside of job/role scope. Receives instruction on specific assignment objectives and possible solutions. Unusual problems are solved jointly with manager. Work is reviewed for application of sound technical judgment. May lead a work group or project team consisting of technical and support staff. Builds internal and external relationships, with emphasis on those that facilitate the achievement of job/role accountabilities, such as relationships with key suppliers, customers and internal service. Detailed Description: Performs tasks such as, but not limited to, the following: ● Works to ensure import / export / domestic shipments and documentation are in compliance with applicable customs law. ● Acts as a liaison with customs offices. Collects and analyses logistics data for trends and potential cost savings. ● Evaluates and selects carriers for shipment of product. Analyses freight data for internal and external charges. ● Interfaces with customers to identify billing information. ● Responsible for the development and reengineering of processes related to border crossings. ● Provides leadership, expertise, guidance and training to the supply chain, commodity, procurement and program management functions, ensuring that the latest logistics practices and procedures are followed & complied. ● Interfaces with various levels of Celestica management to ensure processes are in place and working such that we maintain compliance with Logistics processes. Knowledge/Skills/Competencies: ● Good knowledge of an electronics manufacturing environment, material and processes. ● Expert understanding and interpretation of traffic and customs rules and regulations. ● Knowledge of basic computer applications such as WORD, Excel, PowerPoint and multiple business applications. ● Good understanding of internal and external customer requirements. ● Good financial, analytical, and negotiation skills. ● Ability to identify and resolve high complexity process/system problems using financial, analytical, and/or statistical models. ● Ability to handle multiple tasks while maintaining attention to detail and accuracy and working under tight time deadlines. ● Ability to evaluate, prioritize and problem solve a variety of tasks to ensure their timely and accurate completion. ● Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with a wide variety of internal and external customers. Physical Demands: ● Duties of this position are performed in a normal office environment. ● Duties may require extended periods of sitting and sustained visual concentration on a computer monitor or on numbers and other detailed data. ● Repetitive manual movements (e.g., data entry, using a computer mouse, using a calculator, etc.) are frequently required. ● Occasional travel may be required Typical Experience: ● Three to six years of relevant experience Typical Education: ● Bachelor’s degree in related field, or consideration of an equivalent combination of education and experience. ● Educational requirements may vary by geography

Company Description NIQ/GFK is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods, Tech & Durable manufacturers and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com. NIQ GFK is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Job Description As a Market Insights Analyst, our consultants: Establish themselves as strategic partners to our local and regional clients. Act as internal and external innovation agents, driving change for quicker adaptation to evolving market needs. Serve as market experts, with deep knowledge of the industry, products, channels, and more. In this role, you will: Understand and work with POS-related data with the client (gfknewron market, possibly also predict and/or consumer) and is the central point of contact Ensure effective and efficient client training and onboarding of new customers. Job Summary To perform and execute thorough market research to provide informed strategic procurement decisions and supplier capabilities to facilitate the selection of suppliers based on informed judgment, efficient cost management, risk reduction, and alignment with the objectives of the organisation. Job Responsibilities: 1. Execute and analyse the market following the organization's procurement requirements by conducting exhaustive research on market dynamics, industry trends, and supplier landscapes. Conduct a comprehensive analysis of market data, encompassing competitor strategies, pricing trends, and supply-demand dynamics. 2. To analyse the cost structures and pricing models of potential suppliers to discover potential opportunities for reducing costs and optimising value. Evaluating pricing strategies among various suppliers and engaging in negotiations to secure advantageous terms and conditions. 3. To conduct and execute market intelligence by closely monitoring industry trends, emerging technology, and regulatory developments that have the potential to influence procurement decisions. Offer valuable insights and recommendations to stakeholders by leveraging market knowledge and doing a comprehensive analysis of competitors. 4. To generate insights and recommendations for the procurement tearn and senior management through the preparation of documents containing the results of supplier evaluations, cost analyses, and market research activities, including reports, presentations, and dashboards. 5. To efficiently execute and coordinate initiatives with cross-functional groups, such as procurement, finance, operations, and supply chain, to ensure that market research initiatives are in line with the overarching goals and objectives of the organization. 6. To ensure ongoing enhancement by remaining updated on emerging trends, industry benchmarks, and best practices in procurement market research and recommend enhancements to processes and instruments that will augment the effectiveness and efficiency of market research activities. Qualification & Work Experience 1. Bachelor degree in Supply Chain Management, IT, Business Management or related field 2. Professional qualification/certification in procurement from an accredited body is an added advantage. 3. 3 years in in any combination in the following areas: Vendor management, Information Security and Procurement. 4. Experience in procurement governance and database and analytical software (e.g. Power BI). Technical Competencies/Skills • Sound understanding of CMA and MCMC Act • Knowledge on procurement policies, processes, method, compliance and risk management. • Strong understanding of information security principles, practices, and standards. • Ability to analyze data, establish facts, identify trends and variance, and integrate • information from a variety of sources with varying levels of complexity. • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Behavioral Competencies/Skills • Ability to build and maintain positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders. • Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously to meet goals and deadlines. • Attention to detail with a strong emphasis on accuracy and meticulousness. • Ability to exercise good judgement to identify, access and resolve issues, without compromising governance aspect of procurement procedure and risk management. • Ability to work within extended hours if required to complete urgent tasks/assignment — to meet dateline set by the management. • Flexible, resourceful and quick in responding to ad hoc situations. Candidate must be willing to work in Cyberjaya.

Job Description: Maintain accurate inventory records and ensure stock levels are updated in the system. Conduct regular stock checks to verify that physical stock and system records are tally. Manage stock movements, including receiving, storing, and issuing inventory. Work closely with sales teams to track stock and ensure timely replenishment. Prepare and submit inventory reports to management on a regular basis. Investigate and resolve any discrepancies between physical stock and system records. Support the sales team by coordinating payment requests and ensuring timely submission to HQ for prompt processing. Maintain records of sales transactions and payments for audit purposes. Provide general administrative support, including data entry, document filing, and communication with internal teams. Perform any other duties assigned by the Business Development Director. Requirements: Education: SPM or Diploma in Business Administration (fresh graduates are welcome to apply). A male candidate is preferred for this role, as it may involve carrying heavy items. Minimum of 2 years of work experience in Administration, Operations, IT, or Warehouse roles. Proficiency in English is required, with trilingual ability in English, Chinese, and Malay preferred. Able to work independently and as part of a team. Able to work on-site with technical and project team.
